"My apologies. Since so many horrible things have occurred since then, I had completely forgotten about it until this moment."

「知らないわよ、そんなの。私がしてるのは姉さんの部屋じゃなくて、お父様の部屋の扉の話よぅ？　姉さんがお父様がいるのを確認してから、私と一緒に不在を確認するまでの間、あの扉は一度も開かれてないのよ。扉を使わず、どうやってお父様は外に出たのかしらぁ？」
"I don't know anything about that. I'm not talking about your door, but the door to Father's room, right? Between the time you confirmed that he was in his room and the time we confirmed that he wasn't, that door wasn't opened even once. How did Father get out if he didn't use the door?"

「………そ、…そんなことは知りません…！　私が知りたいくらいです！！」
"......I-I don't know that...! That's what I want to know!!!"

「夏妃姉さんの他に、お父さんの在室を確認したのは誰や。」
"Natsuhi nee-san, other than you, who else checked to see whether Father was in his room?"

「昨夜、金蔵さんとチェスをしたのが会った最後ですな…。…夕食の直前までご一緒だったはずです……。」
"Last night, the last time I met Kinzo-san was when we were playing chess, ...so I was with him until just before dinner......"

「それより後の時間は誰かおらんのか？」
"Who saw him after that?"

「……………私です。昨夜の晩餐のお世話をしております。」
".........I did. I gave him his dinner last night."

「……はい。僕と紗音も一緒でした。」
"...Yes. Shannon and I were with him."

「ここまでは間違いなくお父さんも部屋にいたやろな。
"So at that time, Father was still definitely in his room.

…だがな、夏妃姉さん。不在だった書斎は窓も扉も全て締め切られた状態だったそうやないか。……なのに夏妃さんは今朝、お父さんに会って話をした言うとる。」
...However, Natsuhi nee-san, when you found out he wasn't there, it looks like all ways in or out of the study were closed, right? ...But even so, you said you met with him this morning."

「……わ、……私には皆さんが何を険悪になっとるのかわかりません。…どなたか、説明してくださいますかな…。」
"......I-I don't understand why everyone has become so gloomy. Could someone please explain it to me...?"

「と、……父さんと母さんは、
………夏妃叔母さんが今朝、お祖父さまに会ったというのは、
……嘘だと言っているのかい？」
"...F-Father and Mother,

......are you saying that what Natsuhi says about meeting Grandfather this morning...

was a lie?"

「う、嘘なんかつくもんかよ、母さんは潔白だぜ！！　何で嘘なんかつくんだよ！！」
"L-Like hell she'd lie about that. Mom's guiltless!! Why would she lie?!!"

「朱志香！　言葉遣いを直しなさいといつも言っています！」
"Jessica! I keep telling you to watch your language!"

場が一気に騒然とする…。
All at once, the whole room was in an uproar...

応接テーブルを挟んで、絵羽伯母さんと夏妃伯母さんが対峙し合い、譲治の兄貴と朱志香が対峙し合う…。……何なんだよ一体…！！
Aunt Eva and Aunt Natsuhi confronted each other across the parlor table, with George confronting Jessica... ...What the heck's going on...?!!

「複数の人間の目撃があるのは、昨晩までよ？　でも今朝以降、お父様の姿を見たと称するのは夏妃姉さんただひとり。
"Many people spotted him last night, right? But since this morning, the only one who claims to have seen Father is Natsuhi nee-san.

……そして、私の挟んだレシートが物語る奇妙な事実。…さぁ、この点と点はどうやれば結べるのかしらぁ…？」
...And then there's that strange fact we learned from my receipt. ...So, how can we connect these points together...?"

絵羽叔母さんは、全員に想像するように促す…。
Aunt Eva urged everyone to imagine it...

……確かにこのレシートは、何かの点になり得る。
…だが、何の点とどう結べば線が引けるのかわからない…！
...Sure, that receipt could become an important point.

...But I didn't know which other points to tie it to, or how...!

絵羽叔母さんが期待する答えを探るなら、………夏妃伯母さんが、あたかも祖父さまが在室しているように今朝、嘘をついたことになる。
If we try searching for the answer Aunt Eva probably wants, ...we'll find that Aunt Natsuhi lied and acted as though Grandfather was in the room this morning.

それを、絵羽叔母さんの気まぐれが看破した……？？
Has that fact been exposed by a whim of Aunt Eva's...??

「わっけわかんねぇぜ！！　何で母さんが嘘をつかなきゃならないんだよ！！　その理由がねぇじゃねぇかよ！！」

「……その理由は私も知りたいわよぅ。
"......That's what I want to know.

でもね、朱志香ちゃん？　お父様の在室を偽る価値がまったくないとは限らないのよぅ？　推理小説でもたまに出てくるでしょ？　生存時刻を偽ることによって自分のアリバイを偽証するトリックよぅ。」
But Jessica-chan, you can't be sure she had no reason to lie and say that Grandfather was in the room. After all, you see it in mystery novels every now and then. That trick where people fake the time of death to create an alibi for themselves."

「な、何だそりゃあ？！　そんなの聞いたことないぜ！！」
"Wh-What are you talking about?! I've never heard of that!!"

「…お父様はまだ見付からないけれど、普通に考えれば、もう殺されていると考えるのが自然でしょうねぇ。となれば、必ず近い内に死体は見付かる。…その時、死亡時刻をうまく偽ることができれば、夏妃姉さんはアリバイを作ることができるのよ。……わかる？　みんな？」
"...We still haven't found Father yet, but it's pretty natural to assume he's already been killed. If that's true, there's no doubt we'll find his corpse soon. ...If, at that point, the time of death could be cleverly faked, Natsuhi nee-san would be able to create an alibi. ...Do you understand? Everyone?"

…今朝、夏妃伯母さんが在室を確認したのが実は嘘で、…その時刻に祖父さまは死んでいて？
…それで、とある場所に遺体を移し、そこで今、殺されたように偽装する。
...This morning, when Aunt Natsuhi confirmed that Grandfather was there, she lied, ...and he was already dead at that time?

...And then, she moved the body to some other location...and tampered with it so that, when we find it, we'll think he was killed just a second ago.

……そして自分はみんなと一緒にいたりして、アリバイを用意できるようにする。
...That'd make it possible for her to create an alibi, even just by staying with the rest of us.

……そして、誰かの悲鳴が聞こえた！　とか言って駆けつけて、みんなと一緒に第一発見者になって…、っていう話なのか……？
...Then, she could say `I heard someone screaming', dash over there, and become the first to find the body along with everyone else... ...Is that what Aunt Eva's saying...?

「馬鹿馬鹿しい。推理小説など所詮は娯楽小説！　そんなものばかり読んでいるから、そのような不謹慎な発想に至るのです！」
"Ridiculous. After all, detective novels are merely books for the purpose of entertainment! You can only think of such an indiscreet idea because you read them all the time!"

「そうだぜ！！　死亡時刻を少しくらい誤魔化したって、そんなの警察が検死すりゃ一発でバレるじゃねぇかよ！！　古典の世界だったらともかく、現代日本でそんなトリック、本気で通用すると思ってんのかよ？！　おっかしいぜ？！」
"That's right!! Even if she did try to fake the time of death a little, all that would be blown away in an instant once the police did their autopsy!! That might've worked in the past, but do you really think that kind of trick would work in modern Japan?! It doesn't make sense!"

「……そうかしらぁ？　今朝、南條先生が亡くなった人たちの死体を見て、死亡時刻を曖昧に見積もられたわよぅ？　検死結果は、環境や個体差に非常に左右されやすい。数時間単位で誤差の出る非常にアバウトなものなのよぅ。
"...You think so? This morning, when Doctor Nanjo looked at the corpses, he was only able to give a vague estimate of the time of death, right? Autopsy results are very easily affected by the environment and individual differences. It's a very relative estimate with an uncertainty of several hours.

しかも困ったことに、警察の科学的な捜査は明日にならないとできない。そこまでの正確な死亡時刻を測ることなんて、朱志香ちゃんの言う現代日本でも、そうそう簡単なことじゃないのよぅ？　ねぇ、南條先生…？」
And, unfortunately, the police's scientific investigation will have to wait until tomorrow. It wouldn't be easy to measure the correct time of death so accurately, even in modern Japan. Isn't that right, Doctor Nanjo...?"

「…………検死は、経験と勘の必要な、非常に難しい作業です…。誤診率も非常に高いと聞いております…。確かに、ほんの数時間程度の誤差を出してしまうことは大いにありえるでしょうな…。」
"......Examining a corpse is an extremely difficult task that requires both experience and instinct... I have heard that there is a very high chance of a mistaken diagnosis... I imagine it is very possible for a misreading of just a few hours to occur..."

「…しかしアリバイの世界は数時間もあれば充分やで！　古典のトリックとちゃう！　充分に通用するトリックなんや！　……夏妃姉さん。わしら、あんたを疑いたいわけやないんやで？　疑いとうないから、潔白を示してほしいだけなんや。」
"...However, for an alibi, that's more than enough! It's an old trick! It's a trick that works well enough! ...Natsuhi nee-san, it's not like we want to suspect you, okay? We just want you to prove your innocence so we don't have to suspect you."

「何の潔白を示せというのですか！！　今朝、私は確かにお父様にお会いしました！！　そして心の中に片翼の鷲を刻めとお言葉をいただいて…。……あのお言葉をも否定するというのですかッ！！　それだけは断じて許せません！！　お父様が掛けられた言葉までも否定することは断じて許せません！！」
"What is this innocence you want me to prove?!! This morning, I definitely met with Father!! And he told me to keep the One-Winged Eagle engraved in my heart... ...Are you denying that he said that, too?!! I will certainly not permit that!! I won't let you deny that Father said those words!!"

「……あるいは、お父様の遺体は出てこないのかしらぁ？　普通失踪は死亡宣告に７年掛かるもの。
"...Or, maybe Father's body won't appear anywhere. Normally, a person has to be missing for seven years before they're officially dead.

余命残りわずかなお父様を、７年も延命しその財産を独占するには、何ともうまいやり方じゃなぁい！」
Wouldn't that be a clever way to extend Father's nearly finished life another seven years and keep all of his wealth for yourself?!"

「き、聞き捨てなりません！！　それ以上は聞き捨てがなりません！！　私は右代宮夏妃ッ！！　この身に片翼の鷲をまとう資格はなくとも、胸の中にしかと刻まれています！！　当主跡継ぎの蔵臼の妻として、その責務を代行する私に向かって何たる暴言ッ！！！」
"I-I can't let you get away with saying that!! I can't let you get away with saying any more!! I am Ushiromiya Natsuhi!! Although I do not have the right to wear the One-Winged Eagle on my body, it is certainly engraved on my heart!! What do you think you're saying to the wife of Krauss, Successor to the Head, and the one who will act as such in his place?!!!"

「なぁに？　その銃で私を撃つのぅ？　いいわよぅ？　撃っちゃえばぁ？！　どうせ、言い逃れも思いつかなくて苦し紛れなんでしょう？！　やりなさいよ、暴力で真実を誤魔化してごらんなさいよ…？！」
"What's this? Are you going to shoot me with that gun? Go ahead. If only you'd just shoot! You're just desperate because you can't think of a way out, right?! Do it, just try to obscure the truth with violence...!!"

「く……、このぉッ！！！！」
"...Y-You!!!!"

別に夏妃伯母さんは銃を構えて威嚇してたわけじゃない。
でも、絵羽伯母さんに誘導されるように銃を構えさせられてしまう！
It wasn't like Aunt Natsuhi had been actually holding that gun at the ready and threatening anyone.

But, as she was egged on by Aunt Eva, she did hold it at the ready!

…さすがにこの段階になって、朱志香や源次さんが止めに入った。
...Unsurprisingly, once things got to this stage, Jessica and Genji-san tried to stop her.

"...Calm down, Natsuhi-san. All you've gotta do is swear that Father definitely was in that room. Why are you gettin' so worked up...?"

"Then I want you to explain. How did Father manage to disappear from the room? ...The window was closed tight from the inside. The same was true for the door, right?

……今朝、夏妃姉さんが間違いなくお父様に会ったというなら、…夏妃姉さんには、“開かぬ扉”の密室から如何にしてお父様が部屋からいなくなったかを説明してもらわなくちゃ。じゃないと、姉さんが嘘つきってことに、やっぱりなっちゃうものねぇ？」
...This morning, if you really met with Father, ...then you must explain how Father disappeared from this `unopenable door' closed room scenario. If you don't, that'd mean you're lying after all, right?"

「貴方という人はどこまで私を愚弄すればッ……！！！」
"How far do you plan to mock me...?!!!"

「反論したいなら、ぜひしなさいな？！　そうね、今すぐこの場で釈明をしてみなさい？　そうしたら、貴方を疑ったことを謝ってあげてもいいわ。あの書斎の密室から、お父様は如何にして抜け出したのか！！」
"If you want to argue back, go ahead!! That's right, try explaining it right here, right now. If you do, I'll apologize for suspecting you. How did Father manage to get out from that closed room?!!"

「そんなこと、説明もできませんし、不要です！！」
"I cannot explain, and there's no need for me to do so!!"

"Really? Then let me explain it. Let's take the best parts from my perspective and yours and come up with a more friendly explanation! ...I'll believe what you said about Father still being in his room this morning. However, the next time the door was opened, Father wasn't there. You don't have any objections so far, right?"

「貴方の言うことにこれ以上、耳を傾ける気はありませんッ！！　その軽薄な口を噤みなさい！！」
"I have no desire to hear anything more you have to say!! Shut your frivolous mouth!!"

「私の推理はこうよ？　扉から姉さんしか出入りしていないことは、私が２回確認している。そしてレシートもそれを立証している！　にも関わらずお父様を部屋から出すパズルの答えは？
"My reasoning goes like this, okay? I can confirm that on both occasions, you were the only one to go through that door. And the receipt proves it! So, what's the answer to the puzzle of how Father left the room?

窓よ！　窓から出したのよ。……夏妃姉さんはお父様を、３階の書斎の窓から中庭に突き落としたのよッ！！！」
The window! He was sent out the window. ...Natsuhi nee-san, you threw Father out of the third story window of the study into the courtyard!!!"

"Y----YOUUUUUUUUUUUUU!!!"

"After that, when you left and said you were going to check the doors and windows, you took Father's corpse, which had fallen in the courtyard, and hid it!

多分、その時に、死亡時刻を偽る工作もしたんでしょうねぇ？！」
That was probably when you took some measures to fake the time of death, right?!"

"We'll be fine. I hate shady escorts. In fact, I'd be more comfortable if nobody leaves this room until we reach ours. ......Let's go, George."

「……………僕は、ここでみんなといるよ。」
"......I'll stay here with everyone."

「譲治…！　この部屋に犯人がいるのよ。そんなところにいるつもり…？！」
"George...! The culprit is in this room. Do you plan on staying in a place like that...?!"

「……この部屋を出るということは、…親族の誰かを疑うのと同じことだよ。…僕は、……あんな恐ろしいことができる人間が、親族にいるなんて、信じない。」
"...Leaving this room would be the same as suspecting one of my relatives. ...I...can't believe anyone in our family is capable of something that horrible."

「譲治…！　……あなたからも言ってやってよ…！」
"George...! ...Darling, you tell him too...!"

「………譲治ももう、一人前の男や。…その譲治の仁義が、この部屋から出ぇへん言わせるなら、それも勝手やろ。好きにさせたれ…。」
"......George is already an adult man. ...If his code tells him not to leave this room, then it's up to him. Let him do what he wants..."

「…父さん…。」
"...Father..."

絵羽伯母さんと秀吉伯父さんが出て行く。
見送りの言葉は雨音だけだった。
Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi left.

The only voice that called after them was the sound of the rain.

客間を殺伐とした空気が埋めていく…。
時計を見ると、いつの間にか夕方になっていた。
The parlor was being buried beneath the savage atmosphere...

When I looked at the clock, I was surprised to find that it was already evening.

………そんなにも長い時間、俺たちは不毛なことを考えたり、話し合ったり、罵りあったりしていたのか…。
......Had we really spent that much time worrying about needless things, talking with each other, fighting with each other...?

うんざりした気持ちになりながら、頭を掻き毟ると、
Feeling bored, I started scratching at my head when

……真里亞と目が合った。
...Maria and I made eye contact.

てっきり、テレビに没頭しているのだと思っていたので、少し驚く。
I was a little surprised, since I'd thought she was completely immersed in the TV.

「……今なら信じるぜ。」
"......I believe it now."

「うー…？」
"Uu-...?"

「手紙も殺人も全て、ベアトリーチェの仕業だ。…いや、むしろ頼むからそうだと名乗り出てほしいぜ。………１９人目の仕業ってことにさせてくれ。じゃなきゃ、俺たち１８人はいつまでも互いを疑い合わなくちゃならねぇ…。…これなら１９人目の存在を信じる方がマシさ…。」
"The letter, the murders, everything. It was all Beatrice. ...In fact, I almost feel like begging her to come out and take credit for it all. ...I want it to be the work of a 19th person. Otherwise, the 18 of us will have to keep on suspecting each other... ...I think believing in a 19th person is better than that..."

「…………………………。」
"..............."

「…扉も窓も開けずに祖父さまを外へ連れ出すなんて、ベアトリーチェならお茶の子さいさいなんだろ…？」
"...Bringing Grandfather outside without opening the doors or windows must be a piece of cake for Beatrice, right...?"

真里亞は、一度だけ小さな溜め息を漏らしてから俯き、……そして顔を上げる。
Maria, after taking a single, short breath, hung her head, ...and then raised her face again.

「…………そうだよ。きひひひひひひひ、魔女の前に扉の鍵なんて何の役にも立たないんだよ。……ベアトリーチェは７２柱の全てに精通する。３３位のガァプは望む相手を臨む場所へ瞬時に運ぶ力を与えるし。
"......That's right. Kihihihihihihihi, locking a door is useless against a witch. ...Beatrice is familiar with all 72 demons. The 33rd ranked, Gaap, gives the power to instantly carry the desired person to any location.

…彼女にとって、どのような密室に閉じこもった人間だろうと、連れ出すことは難しいことでも何でもないんだよ？　きひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひ…。」
...To her, taking a person out of any closed room isn't hard at all, you see? Kihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihi..."

「魔女はすげぇな。……頼むから、もしまだ事件を起こす気なら、絶対に人間には無理なことをして、
"Witches sure are incredible. ...Tell her, if she feels like committing another crime, to do it in a way that no human could,

……俺に１９人目を、
……いや、魔女の存在を信じさせてくれよ。」
...and make me believe that a 19th person...

no, a witch, exists."

「……………………………きひひ。……いいよ。会ったら伝えておくよ。」
".........Kihihi. ...Okay. If I meet her, I'll tell her."

くそ…。さっきから自分でもわけがわからなくなるぜ…。
Crap... Nothing's made sense to me for a while now...

１９人目を信じ込まされると、それを否定し、１８人しかいないと信じ込まされると、今度はそれも否定してしまう。
Just when I want to believe in a 19th person, I deny it, and just when I want to believe there are only 18 people, I deny that too.

１８人以外の何かがいてほしいと思うのに、その１９人目を認められない。
Even though I want there to be more than just the 18 people here, I can't accept the existence of that 19th person.

……つまり、１８人以上なのに、１９人未満。
……この屋敷にいる人数は、１９＞Ｘ＞１８。
...In short, even though there are more than 18 people, there are less than 19 people.

...The number of people in this mansion is 19>X>18.

つまり、人数は整数で表せないってわけだ。
So the number of people can't be represented by an integer.

……だが、小数点以下なんてありえないさ。
人の数は整数でしか示せないはずだ。
......However, it's impossible for there to be anything after the decimal point.

You shouldn't be able to show the number of people with anything but an integer.

…なのに、１９＞Ｘ＞１８。
１未満の小数がどうして絡んでしまうんだ…！
...And yet, 19>X>18.

How do you explain the fraction less than 1...?!

無理もないさ。
It's no wonder.

…その１９人目は、~ib~視えない不可視の存在~ib~。
...That 19th person was ~ib~something that couldn't be `seen'~ib~.

だから、整数でしか書けない人数表記では、
That's why, since you can only write the number of people as an integer,

~ib~視えない~ib~。
~ib~you couldn't `see' that person~ib~.

その魔女は、視えない。
ベアトリーチェには体がないから。
That witch cannot be `seen'.

Because Beatrice has no body.

ゆえに、不可視。
Therefore, she is invisible.

１９人目はいるのか、いないのか。
魔女はいるのか、いないのか。
Is there a 19th person...or not?

Does the witch exist...or not?

１９＞Ｘ＞１８。
19>X>18.

…このＸの中に、魔女がいる…！
...The witch exists somewhere in that X...!

絵羽伯母さんたちが去った後も、気まずい雰囲気は残り続けた。
The uncomfortable atmosphere continued even after those two left.

犯人は誰かということを考えること自体が、誰かを疑うのと同じ意味であるという雰囲気が蔓延し、…事件を論ずること事態がタブーのような感じになっていった。
It was thick with the idea that simply thinking about the culprit's identity...would be the same as deciding whom to suspect. ...It had begun to feel like discussion of the case was itself taboo.

だからみんな、口にだけは事件のことを出さなくなっている。
So no one mentioned the case, at least out loud.

……しかし、その分、頭の中はいっぱいに違いない。
口から吐き出せない分が、みんな頭の中ではち切れそうになっているだろう…。
......However, those thoughts were what filled our minds.

All that we couldn't say aloud made our heads feel like they were going to explode...

なので、とりあえずの表向き、客間は平穏を取り戻していた。
全てをうやむやにしながら。
So, at least on the outside, the parlor had once again regained its calm mood.

Everything was left unsettled.

「……少しだけ雨脚が弱まった気がするね。」
"......It feels like the rain's gotten a little lighter."

「うー…？　まだいっぱい降ってるよ。うー…。」
"Uu-...? Still pouring down. Uu-..."

「仮に止んだって、この島には船がねぇんだしな。…船が、明日すぐに来てくれりゃいいんだがよ。洋館バカンスはもうお腹いっぱいだぜ、いっひっひ。」
"Even if it did stop, there's no boat on this island. ...But it'd be nice if the boat came quickly tomorrow. I've had enough of this Western mansion vacation, ihihi."

「母さん、明日、船はいつ来るのかな。」
"Mom, when will the boat come tomorrow?"

「本来なら、帰りの船は今日の３時に来てくれることになっていました。先方も、台風が過ぎてから来直すと電話をしてくれたでしょうが、生憎、電話は不通ですから…。
"Normally, the boat to take them back would arrive at 3:00 today. They probably sent us a phone call to say that they would come after the typhoon passed, but unfortunately, the phones aren't working...

……でも、向こうも子どもの使いではありません。客人の方々の送迎目的だと教えてありますから、恐らく、明日の朝一番で…、
多分９時頃くらいに来てくれるでしょう。」
...But they aren't children over there. They were told to both drop off and collect our guests, so they will most likely arrive first thing tomorrow morning,

...probably about 9:00, I believe."

外はすっかり真っ暗になっていた。
時計を見ると、７時を少し過ぎたところ。お腹も減り始めたところだ…。
It was completely black outside.

When I looked at the clock, I realized that it was just past 7:00. I was starting to get hungry...

厨房では、熊沢が張り切って料理をしていた。
In the kitchen, Kumasawa was cooking enthusiastically.

色々なお皿が並び、郷田の芸術料理からはだいぶ見劣るにしても、充分に華やかなものだった。
She had laid out a variety of dishes, and while they didn't match the level of Gohda's artful cooking, they were still quite gorgeous.

落ち込んだ心を、少しでも食事で盛り上げたいという熊沢の気遣いだった。
It was an act of kindness from Kumasawa, who was trying to enliven everyone's low spirits with some food.

熊沢は、郷田のような職業的料理人にはだいぶ劣るが、決して下手なわけではない。
Kumasawa wasn't nearly as talented as a professional cook like Gohda, but she was far from unskilled.

…むしろ漁村育ちの彼女の手による素朴な料理は、時にとても高い評価を受けるのだった。
...On the contrary, since she had been brought up in a fishing village, the simple food she created was sometimes highly praised.

熊沢が調理を終えた料理を、嘉音が教えられながら皿に盛り付けていた。
Kanon arranged the food Kumasawa had finished creating on plates, under her direction.

嘉音も時には厨房を手伝うが、それが役割として与えられることは少なかったため、懸命ではあったが少々だけ稚拙だった…。
Kanon also helped in the kitchen sometimes, but since he was rarely placed in that role, he was slightly awkward, even though he tried his best...

盛り付けがうまくできていないことを自覚し、嘉音は少しだけ表情を曇らせる。
でも熊沢はそれでいいと微笑んでいた。
Self-conscious about the fact that he couldn't cleverly arrange the food, Kanon's expression darkened slightly.

But Kumasawa smiled as though everything was fine.

「ほっほっほ、綺麗に盛り付けられてますよ。嘉音くんもお上手ですよ？」
"Hohohoh, it's arranged beautifully. Kanon-kun, aren't you skilled."

「……………紗音姉さんだったら、
…もっと綺麗に…。」
"......If it had been Shannon nee-san,

...it would look even more beautiful..."

盛り付けの手を少しだけ止め、嘉音が俯く…。
Kanon stopped arranging the food for a bit and hung his head...

熊沢の料理の補助はいつも紗音だった。
…嘉音は今夜、それを代わっている。
Shannon was the one who always assisted Kumasawa in her cooking.

...Tonight, Kanon was doing it instead.

……そして、紗音の面影と、無惨な最期を思い出し、顔を歪める…。
...And as he remembered Shannon's face and her brutal end, he grimaced...

「…………今は忘れなさい…。」
"......Forget that for now..."

源次はポーンを一手進めながら嘉音に気遣う声を掛ける。
Genji spoke kindly to Kanon as he advanced a pawn.

…客間の空気が気まずくなり逃げ出してきた南條に求められ、チェスの相手をしているのだった。
...Nanjo had escaped from the parlor once the mood had grown sour, and Genji had become his opponent in a game of chess upon Nanjo's request.

「………はい。……今は、忘れます。」
"......Yes. ...I will forget it for now."

「…うむ。それがいいだろう。」
"...Indeed. That is probably for the best."

源次はわざと嘉音の方を向かずに言う。
Genji purposefully refrained from facing Kanon as he spoke.

…今の嘉音にとって、自分の瞳を誰かに見られることは、かえって辛いことなのかもしれないと理解していたからだ。
...He did so because he understood that it might make things tougher on Kanon if he noticed that someone was looking at his eyes.

南條もそれを理解していて、安易な言葉をぐっと堪えるのだった。
Nanjo also understood that and held back any thoughtless words.

「……金蔵さんも、どこへ行かれたんでしょうな…。……ご無事だといいのですが…。」
"...I wonder where Kinzo-san has gone... ...I hope that he is safe, but..."

「………わかりません。…ただ、全てはお館様が望まれ、仕組まれたことのように思っています。……それを邪推することは、お館様にお仕えする家具には過ぎたことです。」
"......I do not know. ...However, I believe everything has proceeded as the Master has hoped and arranged for. ...To distrust that would exceed my role as furniture in service to the Master."

「…源次さんは怖くないのですか…？　私には、今夜まだ何か、良くないことが起こるような気がして、怖いのです…。」
"...Aren't you scared, Genji-san...? I am frightened that something bad will occur again tonight..."

「…………怖いことなど何も。…私はただ、右代宮家にお仕えするだけですので。」
"......I have nothing to be afraid of. ...I serve the Ushiromiya family, and that is all."

南條は、ふぅっと鼻から深く溜め息を吐き出すと、熟考の一手を指すのだった。
Nanjo sighed through his nose and made a carefully considered move.

…南條は少しだけ怪訝に思う。
...Nanjo was very slightly dubious.

……ひょっとして源次は、自分のことを蚊帳の外だと思っているのではないかと。
...Could Genji possibly be thinking that he'd be left out of this?

この屋敷の中で今何が起こっているのか、まったく想像がつかない。
He couldn't even imagine what was happening inside this mansion.

…しかし、金蔵が仕組んだ何かである可能性は決して否定できない。
...But he definitely couldn't deny the possibility that Kinzo had devised something.

…この島をチェスに見立てて金蔵がゲームを行い、その結果、６人の駒が倒れた。
...If you liken this island to chess, Kinzo had opened the game, and as a result, six pieces had been defeated.

……源次はそれを、自分だけはチェス盤の外側にいるから安全だと思い安心しているのではないだろうか。
......Could it be that Genji was calm because he believed he alone was on the outside of the chessboard, and therefore safe?

南條は思う。
Nanjo thought about it.

……このチェス盤の上には、誰という例外はなく、全員が等しく駒として並べられているのではないだろうか。
......Isn't everyone just a piece on this chessboard, lined up equally, without any exceptions?

……金蔵から最高の信頼を得ている源次であっても、…いや、唯一の親友であると自負している自分さえも、…このチェス盤の上に置かれた駒に過ぎないのではないだろうかと。
......Wasn't even Genji, who had gained more of Kinzo's trust than anyone...no, who was confident of his position as Kinzo's only close friend, ...just another one of the pieces laid out on the chessboard?

「………源次さん。…私は、今夜が本当に怖いのです。……無事に明日の朝を迎えられることを心より願っています…。」
"......Genji-san, ...I am truly frightened about tonight. ...I hope with all my heart that we will still be safe when tomorrow morning comes..."

絵羽たちが移動した客室は、ゲストハウスが建てられる前、来客を泊めるのに使われていた本来のものだった。
The guest room Eva and Hideyoshi moved into had originally been built to house guests before the guesthouse's construction.

だからほんの数年前までは、親族会議の度に世話になっている馴染みの部屋でもあった。
So until a few years ago, they had stayed in these rooms every family conference and were very familiar with them.

この部屋はホテルの客室と同じで、ベッドルームにバストイレが付き、同じ閉じ篭っているだけなら、客間よりもはるかに居心地がよかった。
This room was just like a room at a hotel, with a bedroom and a bathroom, so even though they were still shut in, it was far more comfortable than the parlor.

「やっぱり、家族だけだとリラックスできるな。……他のみんなも客室に篭って鍵を掛けてりゃええんや。」
"Guess it's true you can relax more when you're alone with your family. ...Maybe it'd be better if everyone else also shut themselves in guest rooms and locked the doors."

「夏妃姉さんが客間を出るなって威張り散らしてるんだもん。誰も口答えなんてできないでしょ。
"Natsuhi nee-san said that no one could leave the parlor, throwing her weight around. I'm sure no one will be able to talk back.

あの人、ずっと冷や飯を食ってきたから、兄さんが死んでやっと天下が来たって張り切ってんのよ。…まったく、ずうずうしいったらありゃしない。」
She's always been treated so coldly, so now that Nii-san's dead, she's getting excited about finally having so much power. ...Seriously, how shameless can she be."

「…まぁ、そう言うな。夏妃さんもあれで結構がんばっとるんやで。お前も、そう突っ掛からんでもええやないか。
"...Come now, don't say that. Natsuhi-san's doin' pretty well. No need to jump on her like that.

………さっきのレシートの件も、あそこまでは言い過ぎやで。」
......And about that receipt earlier, you went too far."

「……だってぇ。あそこで言わなかったら、もう言うタイミングがないんだもん…。」
"...Come on. If I hadn't said it there, there wouldn't be another good time to say it..."

絵羽は可愛らしく膨れながら、テレビを見ながらベッドに横たわっている秀吉の脇に座る。
Eva, sulking cutely and looking at the television, sat alongside Hideyoshi, who was lying on the bed.

「でも、…………こうして二人きりになるのはずいぶん久しぶりよね。」
"Still, ......we haven't been alone like this for quite some time."

「そうやなぁ。思えば、わしもお前も老けたもんや。譲治が生まれてから、何もかもがあっという間や。」
"You're right. Come to think of it, both you and I have gotten pretty old. Since George was born, everything's gone by in the blink of an eye."

「…本当にあっという間よ。……子どもを作るの、焦り過ぎたかしら。」
"...It really has. ...I wonder if we were too hasty in having a child."

絵羽は遠くを見る目をする。
……そう、あれは千載一遇のチャンスだと思った。
Eva's eyes looked like they were staring off into the distance.

...Yes, she had thought of it as a once-in-a-lifetime chance.

…兄の蔵臼がいつまでも子どもを設けられなかったのだ。
...Her older brother Krauss had been unable to father a child for quite some time.

夏妃と結婚してから６年を経ても懐妊の兆しが見えず、金蔵はそれを不快に思っていた。
Six years passed after his marriage to Natsuhi without any signs of pregnancy, which didn't please Kinzo at all.

自分は、どうせ結婚すれば右代宮の籍を失うのだから、当主跡継ぎが生まれるだの生まれないだのはどうでもいい話。…そう思っていた。
Eva herself had thought that, since her name would be moved outside the Ushiromiya register when she got married anyway, it didn't matter whether a Successor to the Headship was born or not.

それが、ある日。……天の啓示を聞いたのだ。
……あるいは、欲深な自分が聞いた悪魔の囁きだったのか。
And then, one day, ...she had a heavenly revelation.

...Or maybe it was the whisperings of the devil that she had listened to in her greed.

自分が先に跡継ぎを出産できれば、右代宮の籍に残れるのではないか。
…あわよくば、右代宮家を自分が引き継げるのではないか…。
If she could give birth to a successor first, wouldn't she be able to remain in the Ushiromiya register?

...If things went well, might she have a chance to inherit the Ushiromiya family herself...?

相談を持ちかけられた秀吉は、二つ返事で頷いてくれた。
……これは、秀吉も欲深な考えがあったからではない。
When she proposed this to Hideyoshi, he had approved of it instantly.

...This wasn't because Hideyoshi also had greedy thoughts.

…身寄りのなかった秀吉にとってそれは、忘れて久しい親族というものをもう一度感じることのできる機会だったのだ。
...For Hideyoshi, who had no close relatives, it was a chance for him to feel once more the long forgotten thing called family.

だから、結婚する上でどちらの苗字になるかはこだわらないと、あっさり頷き、右代宮姓で入籍することを認めてくれた。
So when they got married, he hadn't fussed over which last name they were to keep...and had quickly agreed to have his name entered into the Ushiromiya family register.

金蔵を口説き落とすのは簡単ではなかったが、絵羽も娘として金蔵の性分を知り尽くしていた。
It hadn't been easy to persuade Kinzo, but as his daughter, Eva knew Kinzo's personality well.

……だから、夏妃に対する不満がもっとも高まっているタイミングを見計らい、見事、婿養子を迎えることを認めさせたのだ。
...So, by choosing the time when Kinzo was most dissatisfied with Natsuhi, she was magnificently able to make him accept Hideyoshi as an adopted son-in-law.

……裸一貫から立身した秀吉に、金蔵はどこか自分と重なるものを見たのかもしれない。
...Looking at Hideyoshi, who had achieved success after starting from nothing, Kinzo might have seen a little bit of himself.

すぐに秀吉を気に入り、入籍を認めてくれた…。
He quickly grew to like Hideyoshi and approved his transfer into the Ushiromiya register...

譲治をやがては右代宮家の跡継ぎにする。
その一念で厳しく育ててきた。
George would eventually become the Successor to the Ushiromiya family.

They had raised him strictly with that purpose in mind.

甲斐あり、譲治はどこに出しても恥ずかしくない素晴らしい青年に成長してくれた。
He had been worth their while and had grown into a fabulous young man, who wouldn't disappoint no matter where he went.

…だから、使用人の紗音如きに恋心を寄せているのが許せなかった。
...That was why he had not been permitted to fall in love with a servant like Shannon.

……だから、紗音が死んで婚約が無効になったとわかった時、……凄惨な事件に衝撃を受ける自分と同時に、可愛い譲治を使用人女如きに奪われなくてよかったと安堵する自分が同時にいた…。
...So when she'd learned that Shannon was dead and the engagement was now invalid, ...though part of her had still been shocked by the gruesome crime, part of her had also been relieved that her dear George wouldn't be stolen by some servant girl...

「………………。………私、
"...............I...

………蔵臼兄さんのことが、昔から嫌いだったわ。偉そうで、威張ってて。自分がやがては当主になるのだと自慢してて。……だから、それに一矢報いてやりたかった。…でも、それは子どもの頃の感情なのよ…？　でも、その感情は、……結局、自分の人生のほとんどを支配した。それだけならまだいい！　……その感情は、あなたや譲治まで巻き込んで、振り回してしまった。」
...have hated Krauss nii-san since long ago. He was so full of himself, always swaggering around. So proud that he would one day become the Head. ...So I wanted to get back at him. ...Was that just a childish emotion...? But in the end, that emotion guided my entire life. If that had been all, then it would have been fine! ...But because of that emotion, I got you and George involved. I used you."

「…………絵羽、そない自分を責めるな。」
"......Eva, don't blame yourself for that."

秀吉は起き上がり、絵羽の肩を抱く。……温かい包容力が伝わる。
Hideyoshi got up and held Eva's shoulder. ...She could feel a warm understanding from him.

「…わしはな、自分の人生はもうとっくに折り返しに入っとる。…でもな、今日までの生活を後悔したことは一度もないで。一度もや。
"...Well, I reached the halfway point in my life long ago. ...But you know, I have absolutely no regrets about how I've lived my life. Not one."

………絵羽と一緒で、他の男どもじゃ味わえん楽しい人生になったと思っとる。……戦争で身寄りを失ったわしに、もう一度家族の温もりを教えてくれた。だから右代宮の家には感謝しとるし、わしの唯一の家だと思っとる。
"......I think that since I've been with you, Eva, I've been able to relish an enjoyable life that other men never will. ...After I lost my relatives in the war, you reminded me what the warmth of family is. So I'm grateful to the Ushiromiya family and think of it as my only one."

………わしとお前が歩んできた人生にな、無駄なことなんか、なーんにもなかった。今日まで、ホンマに楽しい人生やったで。」
"......In this life I've led with you, not a single thing's been wasted. It's really been a fun life up 'til today."

「……ありがとう、
……あなた。」
"...Thank you,

......darling."

絵羽は俯き、秀吉の胸に顔を埋める…。
……客間にいる誰にも、絵羽のこんなもろい姿を想像することはできないだろう。
Eva hung her head, burying her face in Hideyoshi's chest...

...Probably, no one in the parlor could even imagine that this side of Eva existed.

「感謝するのはわしや。今日まで、お前と一緒にいて、後悔した日なんてあらへん！」
「………………私もよ。あなたと一緒になれて、…よかった。」
"I'm the one who should be thankin' you. Until today, there hasn't been a single day I've regretted bein' with you!"

".........Me too. I'm so glad...to have you by my side."

「譲治ももう立派な大人や。わしが見張ってなくてもしっかり仕事ができる一人前や。……どや。正月辺りをのんびりモルジブ辺りで過ごさんか。わしら二人水入らずや。」
"George is already a fine adult. Even if I don't look out for him, he's a man who could do his job well on his own. ...I wonder. Around New Year's, do you want to go spend some time in the Maldives? Just us, no one else."

「……いやぁよ。毎年、年賀状の返礼で寝る暇もないとか言ってるじゃない…。」
"...No waaay. Aren't you always saying that you're so busy responding to New Year's cards that you don't even sleep...?"

「次の正月だけはナシや！　年賀状は見ん。黙って、下のお年玉くじだけチェックするんや。今年はカラーテレビくらい当てたいで！」
"None of that this New Year's! I won't read New Year's cards. I'll just stay quiet and check to see if I've won the New Year's lottery. It'd sure be nice if we won a color TV this year!"

「いやぁだぁ…。モルジブでお年玉くじのチェックなんてしたくないぃ…。」
"No waaay... I don't want to waste time checking the lottery while in the Maldives..."

「じゃあ、そいつもナシや！　……水入らずのんびりで、譲治が生まれる直前の新婚時代の、続きをちょいとしてみんか。」
"Then none of that either! ...How does it sound? Just the two of us, taking it easy like when we were newlyweds, just before George was born."

「………うん。…それならいいわね…。」
「モルジブはええとこらしいで。何もない島に美しい珊瑚礁と水上コテージが並んでてな…。」
"......Yes. ...In that case, fine..."

"I hear the Maldives are wonderful. An island with nothin' on it, surrounded by beaut'ful coral reefs and cottages lined up over the water..."

「……新婚時代の続きって、いつからなの…？」
"......Like when we were newlyweds, you say? Starting when...?"

「仕事納めしたらすぐや。旅行店に聞いてみんとわからんが、多分、大晦日前には、」
"As soon as I've finished up some business. I won't know 'til I ask the travel agency, but probably before New Year's Eve-"

「いやぁ。………今、
…すぐがいい。」
"No way. ......Right now,

...I want to go right now."

ぐずるように、あるいは甘えるように、絵羽は唇をねだる…。
Eva nagged at his lips in a peevish, yet flirtatious manner...

部屋を満たすものは、秀吉が付けっ放したニュースの遠いアナウンサーの声と、無粋に窓を叩きつける雨音だけだった…。
The only sounds that filled the room were the distant voice of the announcer on the news, which Hideyoshi had left on, and the obnoxious pounding of the rain against the window...

コンコンとノックがあってから源次さんが入ってきた。
There was a knock on the door, and Genji-san entered.

「………奥様。お夕食の準備が整いました。お食事は、またこちらでよろしいですか…？」
".........Madam, dinner has been prepared. Will you eat in here again...?"

「…えぇ。ここへ運ばせなさい。南條先生はまだ厨房にいるのですか？」
"...Yes. Have it brought here. Is Doctor Nanjo still in the kitchen?"

「…………はい。次の一手を熟考したいと仰っております。…ご安心を、他の使用人たちと一緒です。」
".........Yes. He has said he wishes to carefully deliberate over his next move. ...Do not worry, he is with the other servants."

「源次さんは祖父さまの相手ができるくらい、チェスが強いもんな。南條先生よりも強いらしいぜ？」
"Genji-san's good enough at chess to be Grandfather's opponent. I hear he's even better than Doctor Nanjo, right?"

「…そうなんだ。昔、相手をしてもらったことがあるけど、あれは勝たせてくれたのかな。」
"...That's right. Long ago, he played against me, but he must've let me win."

「真里亞、もうすぐメシだそうだぜ。しかし、よく一日中テレビを見ていて飽きねぇなぁ！」
"Maria, sounds like it'll be time to eat soon. But look at you, you've been watching TV all day long and you still haven't gotten bored!"

「うー。いつもテレビいっぱい見てるから平気。うー。」
"Uu-. I'm always watching TV so I'm fine. Uu-."

「へー、真里亞ちゃんはテレビっ子なんだね。」
"Heh, Maria-chan sure is a TV kid."

「食事だから、机の上を片付けないと駄目だぜ。」
"Food's coming, so we have to clean up the table."

さっき、真里亞のノートを何ページか破いて、みんなでお絵かき大会をした残骸が残っている。
Earlier, we had torn several pages out of Maria's notebook, and there was now a mess where everyone had been drawing together.

それを朱志香が手早く片付け始める。
……しかし、みんな絵心あるよな。びっくりだぜ。
Jessica began cleaning that up quickly.

...Still, everyone here really can draw. I'd never guessed.

「……源次。絵羽さんたちにも、せめて食事くらい一緒にしないかとお声を掛けなさい。……どうせ断るでしょうが。」
"...Genji, ask Eva-san and Hideyoshi-san whether they'd at least like to have dinner with us. ...Although they will probably turn us down."

「…かしこまりました。」
"...Certainly."

「お父様の次は絵羽さんですか…。つくづく、右代宮家の食卓には全員が揃いませんね。」
"First Father, and now Eva-san... It's quite hard to gather everyone to the Ushiromiya dinner table."

夏妃は再び頭痛が疼き出すのを感じ、軽くこめかみを押さえるのだった…。
Natsuhi felt her headache start throbbing again and lightly held her temples...

厨房から客室はそう離れていないから源次もひとりで行き来したが、客室は少し遠ざかる。
The distance from the kitchen to the parlor wasn't that great, so Genji had gone and come back by himself, but the guest room was a little farther away.

夏妃にみだりにひとりにはならないようにと注意されたし、ついさっき、南條にも危機感をもっと持った方がいいと諭されたばかり。
Natsuhi had warned him to avoid being alone whenever possible, and just now, Nanjo had also admonished him, saying it would be better if he held a little more concern for his safety.

…源次は嘉音を伴い、二人で絵羽たちの客室を訪れていた。
...Kanon accompanied Genji, and the two of them went to visit Eva and Hideyoshi in their guest room.

源次が、コンコンとノックする。
Genji knocked on the door.

「……絵羽さま、秀吉さま。お夕食の準備が整いました。」
しばらくの間、出てくるのを待ったが反応がなかった。
"...Eva-sama, Hideyoshi-sama. Dinner has been prepared."

He waited a short while for them to come out, but there was no response.

「…………源次さま、……これは。」
"......Genji-sama, ...look at this."

嘉音が扉の下を指差す。
Kanon pointed under the door.

……そこには洋形封筒が差し込まれていた。
...A Western envelope had been inserted under it.

こういう差し込まれ方をしたら、それは外部の人間が室内にいる人間に対し、メッセージを残していったように受け取るのが普通だろう。
Normally, when something was inserted this way, it'd be interpreted as a message from someone outside to someone in the room.

…だから、これは絵羽たちに充てた私文書で、彼らが関心を持っていいものではないはず。
...So, since this might be a private note meant for Eva and Hideyoshi, it was not something that Kanon and Genji were supposed to take interest in.

…しかし、その洋形封筒は、……昨夜、真里亞が取り出して全員を驚かせた、あの金蔵の封筒なのだ。
...But this Western envelope...was one of Kinzo's, the same kind as the one Maria had taken out last night and surprised everyone with.

「…………………。…間違いない。お館様の封筒だ。」
"............There can be no mistake. It is one of the Master's envelopes."

「……あるいは、
…………。」
"...Or could it be...

......"

金蔵の封筒ではあっても、……昨日の夜、真里亞が読み上げたその手紙の主は金蔵ではなかった……。
Even though this was one of Kinzo's envelopes, ...the letter Maria read aloud the previous night hadn't come from Kinzo...

源次は一層強くノックを繰り返し、大きい声で呼んだ。
Genji continued knocking a little harder and called out in a loud voice.

「絵羽さま。絵羽さま…！　源次でございます。いらっしゃいますか？！　お返事をお願いいたします、絵羽さま…！！」
"Eva-sama. Eva-sama...! It is Genji. Are you there?! Please answer, Eva-sama...!!"

しかし中からは何の返事もない。
But there was no response from inside.

食事に呼びに行った時、客人が深く眠ってしまっていて起きないことはたまにある。
Sometimes, when the servants went to call some guests for a meal, the guests would be sleeping so deeply that they wouldn't wake up.

…そういう時は、呼びに来たことを示す手紙を挟んでそっとしておくことになっている。
...In times like that, the servants would stick a letter in the door to show that it was time to come out, and leave the guest be.

……しかし、源次はそれにもかかわらず、さらに激しく扉を叩いて絵羽の名を呼んだ。
...But despite that, Genji beat even harder on the door and called out Eva's name.

だが返事はない。
However, there was no answer.

嘉音は扉に耳をつけ、息を殺し室内の物音を探る…。
Kanon stuck his ear up to the door, held his breath, and listened for any sounds coming from inside...

「…………テレビの音らしきものが。…でも気配が感じられません。…お部屋は空っぽかも…。」
"......I hear something that sounds like the television. ...But I don't sense anyone. ...The room might be empty..."

源次はハンカチを取り出し、直接指で触れてしまわないように注意しながら、扉の下に差し込まれている封筒をそっと引き出す…。
Genji took out a handkerchief, and, careful not to touch it with his bare hands, gently pulled out the envelope that had been stuck under the door...

そこには真っ赤な封蝋がされていた。
…封蝋の印は、紛れもなく右代宮家当主の指輪によるもの…。
It was sealed with deep red sealing wax.

...Without a doubt, the mark on that sealing wax had come from the Ushiromiya Family Head's Ring...

「絵羽さま！　絵羽さま！！
"Eva-sama! Eva-sama!!

どうかお返事を！！
Please, answer!!

もうお部屋にはいらっしゃいませんか？！」
Are you still in your room?!"

それでもやはり返事はない…。
But there was still no answer...

二人が屋敷内をぶらりと散歩している可能性はある。
There was a chance that those two were aimlessly walking around the mansion.

…絵羽にとってこの屋敷は生家だ。
気楽に出歩くことは充分に考えられる…。
...This was the home Eva had grown up in.

There was plenty of reason to think that she had gone out on a casual stroll...

源次はポケットをまさぐり、客室が開けられる鍵を含んだ鍵束を取り出す。
Genji groped around in his pocket and pulled out the bundle of keys, which contained the key that would open the guest room.

「……源次さま…？！」
嘉音にも意味はわかっている。
"...Genji-sama...?!"

Kanon also understood what this meant.

……客人の外出を見届けた後に、ベッドメイク等のために鍵を開けて入ることはある。
...They would sometimes unlock the door so they could go in and do things like make the beds, but only after they made sure the guests were out.

だが、それ以外の理由で、ましてや在室の可能性がある状況下でしかも客人の許可なく鍵を開けることは、使用人にあるまじき行為だ。
To unlock the door for any other reason, and especially to do so when there was a chance the guests hadn't given permission and might still be in there, was an action unbecoming of a servant.

…しかし源次は決断する。
………もし、ただノックに返事がないだけだったらここまではしなかった。
...But Genji had decided.

.........If the only problem had been that his knock hadn't received a reply, he wouldn't have gone this far.

しかし、扉の下にある封筒は紛れもなく金蔵のもの。
But the envelope under the door was doubtlessly one of Kinzo's.

……いや、右代宮家当主の洋形封筒。
......Or rather, one of the Western envelopes of the Ushiromiya Family Head.

…そしてその封筒は昨夜の時点から差出人を金蔵に限らなくなった。
...After last night, the sender of this envelope could be someone other than Kinzo.

……もしそれが、金蔵以外の人間から差し出されたものなら………。
...If this letter had been sent by someone else......

「絵羽さま…！　申し訳ございません。お部屋を失礼させていただきます…。」
"Eva-sama...! My apologies. Allow me to enter your room..."

源次は最後にそう断ってから、鍵穴に鍵束の内のひとつを差し込む。
After giving that final notice, Genji stuck one of the keys from the bundle into the keyhole.

鍵が開く音。
……そして、ゆっくりとノブを捻り、扉をゆっくりと開けていく。
There was the sound of the door unlocking.

......And, after slowly turning the knob, he slowly started opening the door.

その隙間から灯りが漏れてきた。
……在室している？　それとも、……電気の消し忘れ…？
Light seeped through the crack of the door.

......Were they in the room? Or had they...forgotten to turn out the lights...?

ガチャン。
*clank*.

…それはドアチェーンを引っ張る音だった。
チェーンが掛けられていたのだ。
...It was the sound of the door chain being pulled tight.

The chain had been secured.

チェーンは外から掛けられないものだ。それは同時に在室も示す。
The chain couldn't be secured from the outside. So it also proved that they were in the room.

部屋の中からはテレビの音声も漏れ聞こえた。
The sound of voices on the TV seeped out of the room.

…灯り、チェーン、そしてテレビ。
...The lights, the chain, and the TV.

それらが示すのは明らかな在室なのだが、………気配がない。
All of these things made it clear they were in the room, ......but there was no sign of them.

源次は扉の隙間より再び絵羽を呼んだ。
だが返事はなかった。
Genji called to Eva once again through the crack of the door.

But there was no answer.

「…………………源次さま…。…………いかがしますか…。」
".........Genji-sama, ......what should we do...?"

使用人たちはその職務上、屋敷内のほとんどの施錠を開けることができる。
しかしチェーンを開ける術は持たない。
As part of their job, the servants were able to unlock almost any lock in the mansion.

But they had no way to open a door with a chain.

……このチェーンを開けるには、切断するしかない。
…それは使用人が通常の業務の中で許されたことでは断じてない。
......The only way to get by the chain was to cut it.

...That was certainly not permitted as part of a servant's usual work.

……すでに不気味な悪寒が二人の背中を駆け上っていた…。
...A creepy chill had already rushed up their backs...

嘉音は再び息を殺し、室内の気配をうかがうが、それでも誰の気配も感じ取ることができなかった。
Kanon held his breath again and tried to sense someone through the door, but even so, he was not able to sense anyone.

「……………私は奥様をお呼びしてくる。…嘉音はチェーンの切断を。」
"......I will call Madam and return. ...Kanon, cut the chain."

「は、……はい…！」
"...Y-Yes...!"

切断する工具を取りに、慌てて駆け出していく嘉音を源次が呼び止める。
As Kanon hurried away to get a cutting tool, Genji called him to a stop.

「待て嘉音…！　………厨房に戻り、熊沢と行動するように。断じて、ひとりで行動してはならんぞ。」
"Wait, Kanon...! ......Return to the kitchen and take Kumasawa with you. You must not act alone."

「……はい…。かしこまりました…。」
"...Yes... Certainly..."

嘉音は、この緊急事態に何を面倒なことを、と思ったようだった。
……だがそれは源次の用心深さゆえのことだった。
It looked like Kanon was wondering why he had to do something so troublesome in the middle of this urgent situation.

...But Genji had said it out of wariness.

…自分はどうなろうと構わない。
...He didn't care what happened to himself.

……しかし嘉音には、万一のことはあってほしくなかった。
...But in the worst-case scenario, he didn't want anything to happen to Kanon.

厨房には、配膳台車に食事を積み込んでいる熊沢と、起死回生の一手がようやく思いついたらしく、それを見せたくて源次の帰りを待っていた南條がいた。
In the kitchen, Kumasawa was piling food on the serving cart, and Nanjo was waiting for Genji, apparently wanting to show him a move he'd finally thought up that might turn the tables on him.

…だが、戻ってきた源次の様子がおかしいことにすぐ気付く。
...But Genji's appearance immediately told him that something was wrong.

「……おや、……どうしましたか、源次さん…。」
"...Oh, ...what has happened, Genji-san...?"

「………南條先生、申し訳ありませんが、この勝負は一度中断させてください。
"......Doctor Nanjo, my apologies, but please allow this match to be suspended for the time being.

………嘉音はチェーンを頼む。熊沢、食事の配膳は一時中断し、嘉音と同行するように。私は奥様のところへ行く。南條先生もご一緒に。」
......Kanon, take care of the chain. Kumasawa, stop setting up dinner for now and accompany Kanon. I will go over to Madam. If you would come with me, Doctor Nanjo."

「な、…何かあったんですかな……。」
"H-Has something happened...?"

源次は事情の飲み込めないままの南條をつれ、足早に出て行く。
Genji took Nanjo, who still didn't know what was going on, and quickly left the kitchen.

「…熊沢さん。申し訳ありませんが、僕と一緒に来てください。」
"...Kumasawa-san, my apologies, but please come with me."

「な、…何があったんですか、嘉音さん……。」
"Wh-What has happened, Kanon-san...?"

熊沢も、南條同様、事情が飲み込めずまったく同じことを口にしながら、廊下へ飛び出していく嘉音の背中を追うのだった…。
Kumasawa said almost exactly the same thing as Nanjo, unable to take in the situation, and chased after Kanon, who had flown out into the hallway...

嘉音は熊沢を伴い、倉庫へ行き、工具箱や壁いっぱいに掛けられたものの中から、チェーンの切断に使えそうな工具を物色する。
Taking Kumasawa with him, Kanon went to a storage room and looked through the tools packed in toolboxes and hanging all over the walls, trying to find something that could be used to cut the chain.

「何を探してるんですか…。…私も手伝いますよ……。」
"What are you looking for...? ...Let me help too..."

「……ドアチェーンを切断するんです。…大きめの番線カッターはどこだっけ…。」
「ドアチェーンを…？　ど、どうしてそんなことをするんですか…。」
"...We're cutting a door chain. ...Where was that large wire cutter..."

"A door chain...? Wh-Why would you do something like that...?"

「…………絵羽さまたちのお部屋にチェーンが。…中にいらっしゃるはずなのに、お声を掛けても返事がないんです。」
"......The chain to Eva-sama and Hideyoshi-sama's room. ...Even though they should be inside, they didn't answer when we called them."

熊沢は、チェーンを切ることと絵羽たちの返事がないこととを結びつけるのに、若干の時間を要したが、切迫した事態であることを理解した。
It took Kumasawa some time to figure out how cutting the chain and Eva and Hideyoshi not answering were connected, but she did realize that this was an urgent situation.

「これなら多分…。」
"That one will probably do the trick..."

嘉音は壁に掛けてあった大型の番線カッターを手に取る。
Kanon took down a very large wire cutter that had been hanging on the wall.

カッターという名だが、形状は大型のペンチとでもいった方がわかりやすい。
It was called a cutter, but maybe it'd be easier to understand if we said it was shaped like a large pair of pliers.

……指を容易に切断してしまえる危険な工具だと注意された記憶が蘇る…。
...Kanon remembered once being warned that this dangerous tool could easily cut through one of your fingers...

嘉音はそれを持ち、階段を駆け上がっていく。
………もう、直感していた。
Kanon took that and rushed up the stairs.

......He already knew instinctively.

…一分一秒を争って開けた方がいい。
...He should fight for every minute, every second to open it quickly.

…………あるいは、
……もう…………。
......Or perhaps...

it was already......

「待ってください、嘉音さん……！　はぁ、…はぁ…！」
"Please wait, Kanon-san...! Haah, ...haah...!"

「……早く！」
"...Hurry!"

ようやく熊沢は追いつき、両膝に手を付いてぜぇぜぇと息をする。
Kumasawa eventually caught up with him, gasping for breath with both hands on her knees.

嘉音は番線カッターを持ち直し扉を見上げた時、あっ、と絶句した…。
When Kanon changed his grip on the wire cutters and looked up at the door, he let out an `ah', struck speechless...

「………な、
……何ですか、これは………。………ひぃぃぃぃぃぃ……。」
"......Wh-

What is...this...... ......Eeeeeeeep..."

顔面を蒼白にして、熊沢が力なく叫ぶ…。
Kumasawa screamed weakly, her face pallid...

無理もない…。なぜなら、そこには、………扉には、……あの、薔薇庭園の倉庫のシャッターに書かれていた魔法陣のように、血のような塗料で、また不気味な図形が描かれていたからだ。
That was no surprise... Because, right there, ......on the door, ...just like the magic circle that had been drawn on the shutter of the rose garden storehouse, there was another eerie shape drawn with a blood-like paint.

もっとも、今度のものを「魔法陣」と呼んでいいのかは怪しい。
However, it would be odd to call this one a `magic circle'.

…なぜなら、それは魔法陣と聞いて一般人が想像するような、円の内側に図形が掛かれたものでなく、もう少し幾何学的な図形が描かれていたからだ。
...Because, unlike what most people would expect, it wasn't a circle with shapes drawn inside it, but a slightly more complicated geometrical shape.

……しかし、その図形の隙間に書き込まれたアルファベットとは異なる奇怪な文字は、紛れもなく、あのシャッターの魔法陣と同じもの…。
......However, those strange characters filling in the gaps, which weren't from the alphabet, were the same kind as the ones on that magic circle on the shutter...

しかし嘉音が絶句しているのは、この魔法陣の不気味さだけではない。
……こんなものは、さっきはなかったのだ…！！
But the thing that had Kanon struck speechless wasn't how eerie the magic circle was.

...It was that something like this hadn't been here a short while ago...!!

厨房に一度戻った。
それから倉庫に工具を取りに行き、そのままここへ直行した。
First, he had taken a trip back to the kitchen.

After that, he'd gone to the storage room to grab a tool and headed right back.

時間に直して５分も経っていないはずだ。
Put those together and it couldn't have been more than five minutes.

…その間に、こんな不気味なものが書き加えられているなんて…？！
...How could someone add something this creepy during that period of time...?!

それらは本当に、今さっき描かれたものらしく、まるで扉が生きて血を流すかのように、だらり、だらりと滴り落ちて、不気味な垂直の赤い筋を下に伸ばしていく……。
And as though it had just been drawn, almost like the door itself was bleeding, several unsettling vertical red lines slowly dripped down, getting longer and longer...

「……ひぃいいぃぃぃぃ…、……ひぃぃぃぃぃぃぃぃぃ…！」
"...Eeeeeep, ...eeeeeeeeeeeeeek...!"

熊沢は腰を抜かして、その場にへたり込む。
Kumasawa's knees gave way, and she sank down on the spot.

…もし熊沢が先にそうしなかったなら、嘉音もそうしたかったに違いない。
...If Kumasawa hadn't done this first, then Kanon surely would have wanted to.

「……ベ…アトリーチェ…さま……………。」
"...Be...atrice...sama........."

「ひぃいいぃいぃ…！　ベアトリーチェさまの仕業ですよ、恐ろしや恐ろしや…！！」
"Eeeeeeeeeek...! It's the work of Beatrice-sama, how horrid, how horrid...!!"

「………………………っ。」
"..................!"

嘉音は唾を飲み込んでから、番線カッターを構えて扉に近付く。
…不気味な魔法陣に近付きたくなんかないし、滴り落ちている不気味な血のようなものに触れたくもない。
Kanon gulped, then readied the wire cutter and approached the door.

...He didn't want to get close to this disturbing magic circle, and he really didn't want to touch the steadily dripping substance that looked like blood.

……だが、近付かなければチェーンは切断できないのだ。
...But if he didn't get close, he wouldn't be able to cut the chain.

悪寒に耐えながらもう一度唾を飲み込み、意を決してからさらに近付いて番線カッターをチェーンに当てる。
Fighting this cold feeling, he gulped again, and after gathering his courage, he went even closer, putting the wire cutter up against the chain.

……そして渾身の力で絞ると、チェーンは想像していたよりもはるかにあっさりと切断された。
...He then pressed with all of his strength, managing to cut through the chain far more easily than he'd anticipated.

切断されたチェーンは左右に分かれ、ちゃりちゃりと音を立てながらまだ揺れ続けている…。
The cut chain fell into two separate parts, which continued to clang as they swayed back and forth...

「………嘉音さん、
………足元に封筒が……。…しかもこれは、…お館様のもの……。」
"......Kanon-san,

.........there's an envelope by your feet, ...and isn't that...the Master's..."

熊沢も扉の下の洋形封筒に気付いたようだった。
そして、封蝋が当主の指輪で刻印が打たれていることにも。
It looked like Kumasawa had also noticed the Western envelope at the bottom of the door.

And that the sealing wax had been sealed with the Head's Ring.

嘉音は、封筒の中身を検めるのと、部屋の中を確認するのとどっちが先か一瞬だけ迷ったが、自分の本来の目的を最優先することにした。
Kanon hesitated for just a second over whether he should open the letter first or check inside the room, but he eventually decided on fulfilling his original purpose.

…嘉音はポケットからハンカチを取り出す。
自分の指紋を扉に残さない工夫だった。
...Kanon pulled a handkerchief out of his pocket.

This was so he wouldn't leave fingerprints on the door.

……もしも最悪の予想が当たっていたなら、………この部屋も警察が調べることになる…！！
...If his worst fears were realized, ......the police would want to investigate this room too...!!

扉をゆっくりと押し開ける…。
部屋の中から漏れていたテレビの音声が、より一層わかるようになる。
He slowly pushed the door open...

He was able to more clearly hear the sound of the television, which had been seeping out faintly this whole time.

「……………………絵羽さま……？」
"...............Eva-sama...?"

ベッドの上に仰向けになっている絵羽の姿があった。……靴を履いたままベッドに…？
Eva was lying face up on the bed, ...on the bed with her shoes still on...?

後から嘉音の背中に隠れながら、恐る恐る入ってきた熊沢が、その絵羽を見て、ひぃッ！と再び短い悲鳴をあげる。
Kumasawa, who had fearfully entered after Kanon and who was hiding behind his back, screamed a short `eeek!' again when she saw Eva like that.

嘉音は、絵羽の靴が最初に目に入ったので、土足でベッドにいる違和感が先に頭に入ったが、…そのまま視線を絵羽の頭の方へずらしていった時、…嘉音も同じように短い悲鳴を口にせざるを得なかった…。
Eva's shoes had been the first part of her that Kanon had seen, so the oddness of wearing shoes in bed was the first thing to strike him, ...but when Eva's head shifted into his line of sight, ...Kanon couldn't help but let out a short scream like Kumasawa...

絵羽の、眉間からまっすぐに、……何かが。
……置いてある？　生えている…？
Right in the middle of Eva's forehead...something had been.........placed?

Something was growing there...?

違う。
No.

…眉間にまっすぐと、
...Right in the center of her forehead...

…古風なナイフ？
Was it an old-fashioned knife?

のような凶器が突き立てられているッ！！！
That or some weapon like it was sticking out!!!

突き立てられた根元から、血が滴り落ち、向こう側のシーツを真っ赤に濡らしていた…。
At the base of where it was stuck in, blood dripped down, staining the sheets on the other side bright red...

熊沢は再び腰を抜かして床にへたり込む。
Kumasawa's knees gave way once more, and she sank down on the floor.

…口をぱくぱくとさせるが、悲鳴を零すこともできなかった。
...Her mouth kept flapping open and closed, but she couldn't even scream.

……絵羽は、眉間に何かの凶器を打ち込まれ、絶命していた。
...Eva was dead, with some kind of weapon sticking out of her forehead.




両目はかっと見開き、自分を殺した相手を確かにその目に焼き付けたのだろうが、…それを伝える口は、すでに永遠に閉ざされていた。
Both eyes were open wide, and the image of the person who killed her must have been burned into them, ...but the only mouth capable of naming that person had been shut for all eternity.

一番見たくないはずの眉間にどうしても目が行ってしまう…。
Even though her forehead was the last place they wanted to look, they couldn't tear their eyes from it...

そこには、凶器が絵羽の眉間から直立するように刺さっている。
その、柄の部分には、単なる工具では考えられないような複雑な意匠がされていた。
Right there, the weapon was stuck into Eva's forehead, standing almost perfectly upright.

And on the handle was a complicated design that you wouldn't expect to see on an ordinary weapon.

……それは、…一言で言えばオカルト的。
…何かの悪魔をデザインしたかのような悪趣味なものだった。
...That thing...could be summed up with the word `occult'.

...It was a vulgar object, with a design that might've been of some demon.

「……秀吉さまは…？　…秀吉さま…！」
絵羽の姿はベッドの上にあったが、もうひとつのベッドは空っぽだった。
"...What about Hideyoshi-sama...? ...Hideyoshi-sama...!"

Eva was on top of her bed, but the other bed was empty.

…秀吉はどこに？！
...Where was Hideyoshi?!

腰を抜かして放心している熊沢を尻目に、念のためバスルームを確認する。
After taking a backwards glance at Kumasawa, still on her knees and stupefied, he checked the bathroom just in case.

その扉を開けた途端に、湯気とシャワーの音が迎えた。
At the moment he opened the door, he was greeted by steam and the sound of the shower.

バスルームは、ホテル等で馴染み深いバストイレの一体型だった。
The bathroom was of the same familiar style as most hotel bathrooms.

シャワーを浴びる時は防水のカーテンで水が飛ばないように仕切って使用する。
When taking a shower, a waterproof curtain was used to keep water from flying out.

その防水カーテンが半分開かれていて、……そこには全裸の秀吉が両目を見開いたまま、バスタブの中に崩れ落ちていて…、その目は嘉音と真正面から向かい合っていた。
That waterproof curtain was half open......and lying tumbled down in the bathtub was Hideyoshi, completely naked, with both eyes open...and pointing right at Kanon.

眉間には絵羽と同じく、悪魔を思わせるデザインの凶器が打ち込まれている。
Just like Eva, a weapon with a demon-like design was stuck into his forehead.

頭部はずっと温水シャワーを浴びっぱなしだったせいで、絵羽のように顔の半分を血で汚しているということはなかったが、…シャワーを浴びたまま絶命する姿は、あまりに悲惨だった……。
Since his head had been under the shower's hot water this whole time, his face wasn't half covered and filthy with blood like Eva's had been, ...but the sight of him dead while still taking a shower was tragic enough......




その時、廊下から夏妃の声が聞こえた。
源次と一緒にやって来たのだろう。
Just then, they heard Natsuhi's voice coming from the hall.

She was probably coming with Genji.

「……ま、またしてもこのような落書きが……。
"...A-Again with this grafitti...

…この手紙は…？　中には何と？」
...What about this letter...? What does it say inside?"

「いえ、…まだ読んでおりません。」
"I don't know, ...I haven't read it yet."

「………迂闊に触らん方がいいですな…。犯人の指紋が残っとるかもしれん…。警察に渡した方がいい…。」
"......We shouldn't touch it carelessly... The culprit's fingerprints might be left on it... We should hand it over to the police..."

「……わざわざ手紙を残すくらいです。どうせ指紋など残っていません。」
"......They went out of their way to leave it here. I'm sure they wouldn't have left fingerprints."

夏妃はそう言い切ると、封筒を拾い上げるのだった。
As Natsuhi said that, she picked up the envelope.

…そして、中身を検める前に、自らも部屋に入り、……そして絶命している絵羽を見つける。
...And before checking its contents, she entered the room herself, ...where she found Eva, dead.

「え、……絵羽さん……ッ！！！！」
"...E-Eva-san...!!!!"

「……奥様…、こちらには秀吉さまも…………。」
"...Madam, ...Hideyoshi-sama is here too......"

「こ、……これは……、
惨いですな……。」
"...Th-This is...

truly atrocious..."

「…嘉音、シャワーを止めてあげなさい…。気の毒にもほどがあります…！」
"...Kanon, turn off the shower... Don't let this be any more pitiful than it needs to be...!"

「は、…はい。」
"...Y-Yes Ma'am."

嘉音はハンカチを握りながらバルブをひねり、シャワーを止める。
Kanon gripped his handkerchief and twisted the valve, turning off the shower.

バスタブの中には、ボディソープの小瓶が蓋を開いたまま落ちていた。
In the bathtub, a small jar of body soap had fallen with its cap off.

……まさに入浴中を襲われたのだろう。
……血の飛沫がまだわずかに白いバスタブに付着していて、白と赤の不気味なコントラストを見せていた。
...It really looked like he'd been attacked while taking a shower.

...There was still a small splash of blood clinging to the white bathtub, and the combination of red and white made a horrible contrast.

「…………南條先生…。」
"......Doctor Nanjo..."

「…わ、……わかっとる……。……死斑は出とらんな…。死後硬直も始まっとらん。おそらく、殺されてから１時間経ったかどうかというところだろう…。
"...I-I understand... ...No signs of postmortem lividity... Rigor mortis hasn't begun either. It would seem that an hour or so has passed since they were killed...

しかし、……このような柄の短い凶器で頭蓋骨を……。考えられん…。」
But even so, ...how a weapon with such a short handle could do that to the skull, ...I cannot imagine..."

脈拍や瞳孔の確認をし、南條は二人が絶命していることを改めて確認する。
Nanjo checked their pulse and their pupils, making certain of their deaths once more.

…嘉音はその事務的な対応を見て、思った。
……そんなことをしなくても、ひと目で絶命してるのがわかるじゃないか、と。
...As Kanon watched this businesslike treatment, he thought.

...Couldn't you tell at a glance that they're dead without doing all that?

南條は刺さっている凶器を抜こうかと考えたが、なるべく現状を保持して警察に引き渡した方がいいと判断し、手をつけないことにした。
Nanjo thought about removing the weapon, but then decided it'd be better to preserve the scene and hand it over to the police, so he left it alone.

しかし、根元の部分をよく見ると刃がない。
…というより、刃物状ではなく、むしろ円錐状。
But a close inspection of the base showed that it didn't have a blade.

In fact, it was more conical than blade-shaped.

…ナイフというよりは、柄の短い槍のような、切ることではなく、突くことを目的とした特殊な形状であることがうかがえた。
...He noticed that, rather than a knife, it was more like a short-handled spear, something with a shape better suited for thrusting than slicing.

人によっては、短い槍ではなく、太いアイスピックと例えるかもしれない。
Some people might have likened it to a thick icepick, rather than a short spear.

しかしいずれにせよ、このような不気味な意匠の施された凶器が、本来どのようなおぞましい目的のために生み出され、そして如何にしてそれを全うしたかは、それ以上言葉で語る必要がまったくないくらいにこうして歴然と示されている…。
At any rate, after looking at this scene, no further words were needed to describe what sort of terrible purpose such eerily designed weapons were originally made for, nor was it necessary to explain how they carried out their function.

夏妃は、バスルームに充満するおぞましい蒸気から一刻も早く逃れようと、ハンカチで口元を押さえながら部屋を飛び出す…。
Natsuhi, hoping to escape the repulsive steam filling the bathroom as soon as she could, covered her mouth with a handkerchief and dashed from the room...

彼らの惨い姿は、一瞬見ただけでもう眼に焼きついてしまっている。これ以上を見ていたら、永遠にその姿が眼から消えないに違いない…。
Just viewing their gruesome bodies for an instant had been enough to burn the image into her eyes. If she looked any longer, that image would surely remain in her vision for all eternity...

こみ上げてくる嘔吐感は、今朝のあの園芸倉庫でのものとまったく同じ…。
夏妃は客室に背を向けたまま、しばらくの間、嘔吐感と戦わなくてはならなかった…。
The rising urge to vomit was exactly the same feeling she'd had that morning at the gardening storehouse...

For a while, Natsuhi couldn't help but stand with her back facing the guest room, fighting that sickness in her stomach...

「……と、………とにかく、この部屋を子どもたちに、…譲治くんに見せるわけには行きません。至急、この部屋を閉じなさい…！」
"......A-At any rate, we can't let the children...we can't let George-kun see this room. Seal this room with all haste...!"

「………え、…えぇ、見せられませんとも…。両親のこんな惨い姿をとても譲治さんには……。」
"......Y-Yes, we mustn't let them see... If George-san saw his parents in this brutal state..."

だが、廊下を猛烈に走り近付いてくる足音は、部屋に飛び込んでくる前から譲治のものであることが理解できた。
But they could tell that those fiercely racing footsteps in the hallway belonged to George, even before he came dashing into the room.

譲治は、子どもたちと一緒に客間で待っていた。
George and the other children had been waiting in the parlor.

だが、源次が夏妃を呼び出し、夏妃が真っ青になって客間を飛び出していくのを見て、虫の報せを感じたのだった。
However, when they saw Genji speak to Natsuhi, when they saw her turn pale and fly out of the parlor, they'd felt a sense of foreboding.

そして、客室に大勢が集まっているのを見て、確信する…。
And when they saw a large group of people gathered around the guest room, they were sure of it...

「父さん！！！　母さんッ！！！」
"Father!!! Mother!!!"

「………ぅあッ、
な、……何だよこれ、
また、……魔法陣かよッ？！」
"......Aaahh,

wh-what is this...?

Another...magic circle?!"

「………………………………。」
"..............."

「絵羽伯母さんたちは無事なんだよな？！　おい、嘉音くん！　これは何の騒ぎなんだ？！」
"Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi are safe, right?! Hey, Kanon-kun! What's this all about?!"

「…戦人さま…。……………………………。」
"...Battler-sama.................."

嘉音が語らなくとも、部屋に飛び込んだ譲治の叫びで、彼らは全てを理解するのだった。
Kanon didn't have to say anything. George's scream after he ran into the room told them everything they needed to know.

「……うわああぁあああぁあぁぁぁああぁぁあぁあぁ！！　誰がッ、
…誰がこんなことをッ！！　殺してやるッ、殺してやるッ！！！」
"......Uwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaggggh!! Who...

who did this?!! I'll kill you, I'll kill you!!!"

「…譲治くん、
………しっかり……。」
"...George-kun,

......hang in there..."

夏妃は譲治の肩に手を触れるが、それは乱暴に振り払われる。
Natsuhi touched George's shoulder with her hand, but he violently shook her off.

…譲治は絵羽のベッドの傍らに崩れ落ち、母の面影の前でベッドに顔を埋めながら号泣する。
...George fell over beside Eva and buried his face in the bed in front of his mother's face, wailing.

そして何度も何度も握り拳をベッドに打ちつける…。
Then he pounded on the bed with his fist, over and over again...

「………じょ、
…譲治兄さん、
……し、しっかり……。
"......G-

George nii-san,

...h-hang in there...

………って、
…戦人？」
......Huh,

...Battler?"




「…………戦人さま…。」
"......Battler-sama..."

戦人は、………廊下の壁に背中を付き、……はばかることなく、右手で両目を覆いながら嗚咽を漏らしていた……。
Battler......had his back against the wall of the hallway...and was covering his eyes with his right hand and weeping without restraint...

「酷ぇ……。…………酷ぇぜ……。……心に決めた女を婚約した次の日に失って。………同じ日に、…親父とお袋まで殺されるなんてよ…。…………そんなの、あんまりにも惨いじゃねぇか……。」
"Horrible... .........That's horrible... ...He proposed to the girl he loved and lost her the next day. ......And on the same day, even his Mom and Dad were killed... ......I-Isn't that too harsh...?"

…もちろん、死んだ誰もが等しく気の毒だった。
でも戦人にとって、……死なれ、残った者の方がずっと気の毒だった。
...Of course, it's sad whenever anyone dies, no matter who it is.

But to Battler, ...those left alone by the deaths of others were far more worthy of pity.

今この場にいる誰もが近しい人を失ってる。
譲治だけが気の毒なわけじゃない。
Everyone here now had lost someone close to them.

George wasn't the only one to be pitied.

……しかし、…譲治のそれは、群を抜いた。
...However, ...George's pain was far greater than everyone else's.

「………………戦人………。」
".........Battler......"

"I know...everyone dies sooner or later... If you're human, you'll eventually have to fight the sorrow of losing someone close to you. ...But still, shouldn't that day be far in the future for Aniki, ...and shouldn't those deaths visit him one at a time...?!! ...Horrible, it's too horrible... ...That bastard...

野郎………！
That bastard......!

少しは、……人の情けってもんがねぇのかよ…！！　ううっぅううぅぅッ！！！」

真里亞が無機質な声で戦人を慰める…。戦人は乱暴に自分の涙を拭った。
Maria tried to comfort Battler in a mechanical-sounding voice... Battler violently wiped his tears.

"Yeah... Damn it, ...I won't cry anymore... Tears of regret, tears of sadness, I won't shed them again... ...Aah, it's all useless. The witch's got me backed into a corner. I'm always on the defensive...! And that's useless, it's all useless! I'll spin the chessboard around...!! That bastard probably thinks we'll be running scared like sheep until tomorrow before we try anything. ...But guess what, I'll spin it around!! That bastard can't escape this island until tomorrow either...! We won't be hiding away, pissing ourselves, that bastard will! I'll expose you, you'll see. By tomorrow, ...no, screw tomorrow. Tonight."

夏妃が全員に、有無を言わせない口調でそう宣言する。
Natsuhi announced it as though she didn't care whether they agreed or not.

…反論する者がもしもいるとすれば、それは譲治だったが、…譲治ももう充分に涙を流したのだろう。
...If anyone had a right to object, it would've been George, ...but he looked as though he'd shed enough tears.

譲治が背中を向けたまま小さく頷き、立ち上がると、それで他の全員も同意した。
George nodded slightly, still facing away from the others, and when he stood up, everyone else agreed too.

夏妃は拾った当主の洋形封筒をまだ開けていなかった。
Natsuhi still hadn't opened that Western envelope of the Family Head that she'd picked up.

…だが、話の流れから、この部屋を出ることになってしまったので、開封は客間でみんなの前で行うことにした。
...But now that they'd decided to leave this room, she decided to unseal it in the parlor, where everyone could watch.

そして客間へ戻ろうと廊下を歩き出すと、………すぐに違和感、…あるいは異常に気付く者が現れた。
As soon as they walked out into the hallway to head back to the parlor, ......some of them immediately felt something out of place, ...or maybe sensed something strange.

When everyone sniffed the air, ...they did notice a horrible burnt smell drifting through the hallway, one that none of them had smelled until then.

After noticing a burnt smell, it was natural that Kumasawa, who had just been using the burner in the kitchen, suspected that her own slip-up had caused it. Kumasawa hastily dashed away.

夏妃は、防犯上の都合から窓を開けることを渋る。

So, does this mean the culprit couldn't have gone in or out through the door...?"

祖父さまが部屋から消えたと騒いだ時。
Back then, we were all losing our cool, wondering how Grandfather had disappeared from his room.

…絵羽叔母さんが気まぐれに挟んだレシートによって、扉は封印されていたことが明かされ、その間、出入りした唯一の人物として夏妃伯母さんが疑われることとなった。

絵羽叔母さんは、夏妃伯母さんが祖父さまを窓から突き落として、自分は扉から出たのだというそれはそれで筋の通った説を展開してみせた。
Aunt Eva proposed a theory about how Aunt Natsuhi might've thrown Grandfather out the window...and left by the door herself.

しかし今度の扉はもっと単純だ。
But this door is much simpler.

内側からドアチェーンで封印されていた。
窓も内側から閉まり、遺体も室内にある。
It was sealed from the inside by the door chain.

最初はシャッター。
The first was the shutter.

使用人室に鍵があり、それを知る者を仮定するならば、とても密室とは言えない代物だった。
There was a key in the servant room, and if we assume someone knew about that, this can't really be called a closed room.

次はレシートで封印された扉。
The next was the door sealed by the receipt.

だが、夏妃伯母さんが室内に入っている以上、祖父さまを例えば窓から出して、あるいは突き落として、夏妃伯母さんが窓を施錠してから退出することもできる。
However, Aunt Natsuhi entered that room, so if Grandfather had left through the window or been thrown out, she would've been able to lock the window before escaping.

もしくは俺の珍説のように、レシートがなくなるまで隠れていて、その後に部屋を出たとか。……とにかく、苦し紛れないくつかのトリックで破れなくもない扉だ。
Or, like my theory, Grandfather could've hidden until the receipt was gone and left the room later. ...Basically, this door can be defeated with a handful of desperate tricks.

その意味では、これまた密室とは言えない代物だ。
In that sense, you really can't call this one a closed room either.

そして今度はドアチェーンで封印された扉。
And now, we have the door sealed with the door chain.

…今度こそお手上げだった。
扉も窓も全て内側から施錠されていた。完全な密室だ。
...Finally, we have to give up.

The window, the door, ...everything had been locked. It was a perfect closed room.

最初の密室は、全員が疑えるので成立しない。
…次の密室は、夏妃伯母さんを疑えるので成立しない。
The first hadn't been a closed room because everyone could be suspected.

...The second hadn't been a closed room because Aunt Natsuhi could be suspected.

…だが今度の密室は、誰も疑うことができない！
部屋は完全に密室で、全員を等しく拒むドアチェーンという封印がある…！
...But this time, no one can be suspected!

This was a perfect closed room, because the door chain formed a seal that blocked everyone equally well...!

「……なら、犯人は室内に入らずに犯行に及んだ…？　部屋の外から何らかの方法で…。」

"Good point... Even though the chain makes it impossible to open it wide enough for a person to fit through, you can open it a small crack. Did the culprit knock on the door to make them peer out...before attacking them...? Wait, ...am I missing something...?"

だが絵羽伯母さんは部屋の奥のベッドの上！　しかも秀吉伯父さんはバスルームだった。チェーンの隙間からでは、姿を見ることもできねぇし、手を伸ばすこともできねぇ。…畜生、全然駄目だぜ、さっぱりだ！！」
But she was on the bed at the back of the room! And Uncle Hideyoshi was even in the bathroom. Looking from the crack in the door, you couldn't even see them, and you couldn't reach them with your hands either. ...Damn it, it's all useless. I don't have a clue!!"

……くいくいと、俺の袖が引っ張られる。…真里亞だった。

"......Kihihihihihihihihihihihihi. ...Battler, since you didn't want to suspect any of your relatives, you made a wish, saying you wanted the culprit to be Beatrice, right?"

だからベアトリーチェは叶えた。…戦人が言ったとおり、“絶対に人間には無理なことをして、戦人に魔女の存在を信じさせて”くれた。
"Well, Beatrice granted that wish. ...Just as you asked, she `did something that was completely impossible for a human to make you believe in the witch'.

…………なのにわがまま。きひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひ、

あ痛っ。」
O-uch."

"Sure, thanks for granting that wish. That just now was to thank you, and also to teach you to stop laughing when it's inappropriate. More importantly, tell me. There was another mysterious scribble on the door to Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi's room. Was that another magic circle?!"

Uu-, ...I'll say it, I'll say it, stop hitting me. ......That's the first magic circle of the moon."

"The words are from the Old Testament, Psalms 107 verse 16. ...`For he has broken gates of brass and cuts through bars of iron'. ...This magic circle has two effects. First, it can open a door regardless of which method has been used to lock it."

「開かぬ扉を八方塞の事態に見立て、扉を開く。……難解な事態の時に用いることで、それまで思いつきもしなかった解決策を与えてくれるんだよ。……平たく言うと、観察力や洞察力、ひらめきや直感を授けてくれるんだね。…………きひひひひひひひひひ。ベアトリーチェは、戦人如き人間風情に、この扉の開き方がわかるものかって、挑発してるんだよ。きっひひひひひひひひひひひひひひ、
"When you're blocked by unopenable doors in all directions, it opens a door. ...By using it in a difficult situation, it gives you a solution you hadn't even thought of until then. Generally speaking, you receive the powers of observation and discernment, inspiration and intuition. .........Kihihihihihihihihihi. Beatrice is trying to provoke you, since there's no way lowly humans like Battler could figure out how this door was opened. Kihhihihihihihihihihihihihihihi,

あ痛っ。」

「……真里亞ちゃん。…この世に魔女も悪魔も存在しない。…父さんと母さんは誰かが殺した！　それが僕のよく知る人間なのか、知らない人間なのかはわからない。でも、そのどちらであっても必ず人間なんだ…！！」

"At any rate, I can hardly stand this stench. ...What in the world could it be...?!"

先行する熊沢と嘉音は、厨房に着く前に、臭いの発生元は厨房ではないことに気付く。
Kanon and Kumasawa, who had gone on ahead, realized the smell wasn't coming from the kitchen even before they arrived there.

なぜなら、厨房に至る途中にある、地下への階段からさらに濃密な悪臭が登ってくるのに気付いたからだ。

「………ボイラー室…。」
