"...I wonder if there's something wrong with the boiler again..."

その階段は地下のボイラー室へ通じるものだった。
Those stairs led to the underground boiler room.

屋敷のボイラーは古く、このところ調子も悪い。
The mansion's boiler was old and in poor condition.

二人も何度かボイラーの不調に立ち会ったことがあるが、このような臭いを噴出す不調は初めての経験だった。
Both of them had witnessed problems with the boiler on several occasions, but they had never smelled the boiler belching out a stench like this before.

バタン。
*slam*.

「い、今の音は……？！」
"Wh-What was that sound...?!"

地下より聞こえたその音は、確かに扉が閉じる音だった。
The thing they heard from the basement was definitely the sound of a door closing.

……熊沢も、問い掛けるように言いはしたが、それ以外の何の音でもないことをすでに理解している。
...Kumasawa had phrased it as a question, but she already knew it couldn't be anything else.

熊沢はその音に大層驚き、再び腰をぬかしてへたり込んでしまう…。
Kumasawa was so surprised at that sound that her knees gave way yet again and she cowered...

……なぜなら、~ib~今この瞬間、ボイラー室にいられる人間はいないからだ~ib~。
...After all, ~ib~at that very moment, no one could have been in the boiler room~ib~.

さっきの絵羽たちの部屋に全員が揃った！　なら、今の扉の音は何者に発せられる音だというのか！
Just a few seconds ago, everyone had been crowded together around Eva and Hideyoshi's room! So who caused the sound of a door closing just now?!

「……………………………！」
".....................!"

「嘉音さん…！！」
"Kanon-san...!!"

嘉音は瞬時に状況を整理し、地下へ駆け下りる…！
After taking a second to sort out the situation, Kanon ran down towards the basement...!

今、扉を閉じる音がしたのに、誰の気配も登ってこないということは、扉を閉めた何者かはボイラー室の中にいるということだ。
Since they'd heard the sound of a door closing just now, and there was no sign of anyone coming up the stairs, the person who'd closed the door had to be inside the boiler room now.

もしボイラー室が袋小路だったなら、嘉音は焦って飛び出したりはしなかった。
If the boiler room had been a dead end, Kanon wouldn't have rushed in so hastily.

…しかし、嘉音は使用人だから知っている。
ボイラー室には屋敷側からの入口と、中庭側からの入口の２つがある。
...But Kanon was a servant, so he knew.

There were two entrances to the boiler room, one that opened to the mansion and one that opened to the courtyard.

今追わなければ、取り逃がすかも知れないのだ…！
If he didn't chase them now, they might slip away...!

熊沢も、嘉音にだいぶ遅れて、その思考を理解する。
…しかし、ひとりで行かせてはならない…！
Kumasawa reached the same conclusion long after Kanon did.

...But she couldn't let him go alone...!

もし、ボイラー室にいる存在が犯人で、…最初の殺人で大人６人をやすやすと殺して見せたほどの相手なら、嘉音１人が取っ組みかかったところでどうにかなる相手ではない。
If the thing in the boiler room was the culprit, ...an opponent who had easily killed six adults in the first murder, then no matter how Kanon confronted them, he wouldn't be a match.

…その論法なら、熊沢が１人加勢したところで何の意味もないのだが…。
とにかく熊沢は、嘉音をひとりで行かせてはならないと思い、遅れて階段を駆け下りる…！！
...Of course, with this argument, even if Kumasawa joined him, it wouldn't change anything...

At any rate, after a delay, Kumasawa decided that she mustn't let Kanon go alone, and she rushed down the stairs...!!

その時点で、嘉音はすでにボイラー室にいた。
At that time, Kanon was already in the boiler room.

ボイラー室独特のじめじめした熱気が苛む。
…もともと、不快な湿気と臭気の篭っている場所だった。
The boiler room's characteristic damp heat tormented him.

...It had always been an unpleasantly smelly and hot place.

しかもその上、あの悪臭が充満していて、嘉音は吐き気すら催す。
……この部屋が発生元であることは疑いようもなかった。
And on top of that, the room was full of that horrible stench, ...which made Kanon feel like he was going to be sick.

......There was no doubt that this room was the source.

なら、それがどこから発せられているのか、嘉音は探るべきなのだ。
だが、嘉音は正面を見据えたまま、入口のすぐ脇にある工具棚から鉈を掴み取る。
In that case, Kanon should have been searching for where the smell was coming from.

However, Kanon kept gazing straight forward as he grabbed a hatchet from a tool shelf just off to the side of the door.

……鉈が欲しくて手を伸ばしたのではない。
…武器になるものなら何でもいいから、手に取りたかったのだ。……なぜ？
...He hadn't stretched out his hand because he'd wanted a hatchet.

...He had wanted to grab a weapon, any weapon. ...Why?

「……………………………………………。」
"........................"

嘉音は、裸電球程度では到底切り裂けぬ闇の中を凝視する。
Kanon gazed into the darkness where the naked light bulb couldn't pierce.

……そして、~ib~答えた~ib~。
...Then, he ~ib~answered~ib~.

「………………ルーレットは、数字と赤黒に賭けて配当を競い合う。……だが、赤か黒かのような、リスクの低い賭けは、その程度の配当しか与えられない。」
"............In roulette, you bet on a number or the colors red or black, vying for a payoff. ...However, low-risk bets like black and red only offer a similarly low payoff."

嘉音の口から紡がれる言葉が、…深い闇に飲み込まれていく。
その闇が不意に、煌きながら、渦を巻き始める…。
The words coming from Kanon's mouth...were swallowed up by the darkness.

That darkness suddenly started to swirl, glittering...

それは、……とても幻想的な光景…。
It was...such a fantastical scene...

ボイラー室のあちこちの影に隠れていた黄金に輝く蝶たちが、…美しく瞬きながら羽ばたき、…闇の中へ集い消えていく…。
Golden sparkling butterflies that hid in the shadows all over the boiler room...flapped their wings, twinkling beautifully, ...and gathered in the darkness, disappearing...

嘉音は、蝶たちを飲み込む闇に向かって言い続けていた。
……しかし、闇の中に集った蝶たちは、………多分、恐らく、いや、どうせ、……笑う。
Kanon continued speaking, directing his words at the darkness as it swallowed the butterflies up.

...But as the butterflies gathered in the darkness, they......perhaps...probably...no, they would certainly...laugh.

…しかし嘉音はまったく怯むことなく、言葉を続けた。
...But Kanon continued to speak without faltering in the slightest.

「…逆に、より的中率の低い賭け方をすれば、そのリスクに比例した配当が与えられる。…………お館様は、天文学的なリスクを的中できることを“奇跡”と呼び、その結果得られる天文学的な配当を“魔法”と呼んでいた。
"...However, if you bet on something with a lower probability, your payoff increases proportional to the risk. ......The Master called succeeding despite an astronomical risk a `miracle', and called the astronomical payoff gained as a result `magic'."

…………お館様とお前が、どんな“魔法”を求めてルーレットに挑んでいるのか、そんなことには興味ない……。しかし、お前は忘れている。……ルーレットには、赤でも黒でもない目が出得ることを、忘れている。」
"......I have no interest in what kind of `magic' you and the Master were seeking when you spun that roulette... But you forgot something. ...You forgot that in roulette, there's a pocket that's neither black nor red."

ルーレットには“０”という特殊な目があり、ルールによっては親の総取りを意味し、盤面に賭けた全てのコインが流れてしまう、あたかも没収試合のような目がある…。
Roulette has a special pocket called `0', which means that the house takes everything in certain variants of the game. This means that all of the coins bet on the table will be swept up, just as though everyone has forfeit...

「………僕は、ひとつだけ心に決めていた。……もし。………紗音が殺されて、僕が生き残るようなことがあったなら。………この身を投げ出して、お前のルーレットを全て台無しにしてやろうと…！」
"......I set my heart on just one thing. ...I decided that if......Shannon were to be killed, and I was left alive, ......I'd sacrifice this life of mine and bring this roulette of yours to ruin...!"

「…………これは、お館様が決めたルールでも、…ましてやお前が決めたルールでもない。………このルールは僕が作った。
".........This isn't one of the Master's rules, ...and it certainly isn't one of yours. ......I made this rule myself.

………僕は、もう家具じゃない。………お前のルーレットの、ゼロなんだ…！」
......I'm not furniture anymore. ......I'm the zero on your roulette...!"

…嘉音の顔が、屈辱に、歪む。
………彼の克己に対し嘲りが与えられたのは明白だった。
...Kanon's face...twisted with humiliation.

......It was clear that his defiance against his own weaknesses was being ridiculed somehow.

嘉音の眉間がさらに、歪み、…嘉音が誰にも見せたことのないだろう激情を表情に浮かべる。
Kanon's brow creased even further, ...and a fierce expression that he'd never shown to anyone appeared on his face.

……鉈を握る手が震える。…汗が雫となって伝い落ちる…。
...The hand grasping the hatchet was shaking. ...His sweat became drops, which slid downward...

嘉音の手を震えさせているのが、怒りの感情だけではないことは明白だった。
…だが、嘉音はその感情を飲み込む…。
It was clear that the emotion causing Kanon's hand to shake wasn't just anger.

...However, Kanon suppressed that emotion...

「…………………僕はもうお前の言葉に惑わされたりはしない。………悪魔のルーレットはこれでおしまいだ。
"......I won't let your words lead me astray again. ......This is where the Demons' Roulette ends.

…じ、
……地獄にてさらに千年、次の召喚者を待つがいい、
ベアトリーチェえええぇええぇッ！！！」
...W-

Wait another thousand years in hell for your next summoner,

Beatriiiiiiiiiiiiiiice!!!"




嘉音が鉈を振り上げて闇に飛び込もうとした時、闇は確かに嘲笑った。
その勇気を、低俗かつ無為無駄無意味だと嘲笑った。
When Kanon raised the hatchet and tried to dive into the darkness, the darkness definitely sneered.

It sneered at that courage as if it were vulgar, lazy, futile, and meaningless.

……そして嘉音は、鉈を振り上げた姿のまま、………もうそれ以上、一歩も踏み出すことはできなかった…。
......Kanon, his hatchet still held aloft, ......couldn't take another step after that...

ガランという音は、嘉音が握っていた鉈を落とし、それが床に転がったもの…。
With a *clang*, the hatchet that he'd been grasping fell and rolled on the floor...

そして、次に二度続くドサリという音は、嘉音が両膝を、左、右…と順に着く音…。
And following that, with a pair of thuds, Kanon's knees hit, ...left, then right...

鉈を落とした後は、まるで空を掴もうとするかのようにも見える、その腕は徐々に下がり。……胸元に当てられる。そしてもう片方の手も。
That hand, which looked like it was trying to catch the sky now that the hatchet had been dropped, gradually lowered, ...landing on his chest. Then, the other hand did the same.

……そこには、……悪魔を描いた意匠の掘り込まれた柄が。
嘉音の胸に、……絵羽たちの眉間に刺さっていたあの凶器が……。
...Right there...was a handle with a demonic design engraved in it...

As Kanon looked down at his chest, the same type of weapon that had been stabbed into Eva and Hideyoshi's foreheads was...

「……………ぅ
…………………く、
…………。」
".........Nnng,

............ghh,

......"




苦悶に歪む嘉音の口の端から、鮮血が零れ落ちる…。
Kanon was curled up in anguish, fresh blood dribbling from the corner of his mouth...

…それは、嘉音の白い肌には過ぎた化粧…。
...It was...makeup too extreme for Kanon's white skin...

その様子に、闇の中に煌く黄金の蝶たちが蟲惑的に舞い踊る…。
Around this scene, the glittering gold butterflies danced through the darkness, mesmerizing...

それは美しき美しき、ひとりの少年の克己への賛辞と嘲りと侮蔑と葬送の舞い。
It was a beautiful, beautiful dance...a funeral march of tribute, ridicule, and contempt for a single boy's self-sacrifice.

…嘉音は自身の絶命をすでに覚悟していたが、……与えられた死を、そのままの形で受け容れることにだけでも、最後の抵抗を試みる。
...Kanon had already been prepared for his own death, ...but although he could do nothing but accept the death he had received, he attempted one last measure of resistance.

…そして両手で胸に刺し込まれた凶器の柄を握り、…………この世のものと思えぬ激痛に歯を食いしばりながら……………、…………………………抜く。
...He grasped the handle of the weapon sticking into his chest with both hands, ......and gritting his teeth with an acute, unearthly pain, .....................he pulled it out.

一瞬だけ、真っ赤な飛沫が噴出す。
For only a moment, a bright-red spray gushed out.

……そして、ごぽりと、…不快な音をさせた。
...It made an unpleasant *bloop* sound.

それは多分、嘉音の魂を死者の沼が飲み込んでいく時と同じ音…。
It probably resembled the sound of Kanon's soul as it was sucked into the swamp of the dead...

「……………嘉音さんッ？！　ひぃいいいいいぃッ！！！　だ、誰かぁああぁあぁぁ！！　ひぃぃぃぃいいぃぃッ！！」
"......Kanon-san?! Eeeeeeeeeeeeek!!! S-Someoooooooone!! Eeeeeeeeekkk!"

熊沢は眼前の受け容れがたい光景に絶叫した。
Kumasawa screamed at the incomprehensible sight in front of her.

血の海に横たわる嘉音…。
…熊沢の胸中は混乱で滅茶苦茶だった。
Kanon was lying in a pool of blood...

...Kumasawa's heart was a complete mess.

あぁ、何という不運！
Aah, what a horrible fate!

自分と一緒だったなら殺されなかったのに！
He wouldn't have been killed if I had been with him!

あぁ、何という幸運！
自分と一緒だったなら自分も殺されていたかもしれない！！
Aah, what incredible luck!

If I had been with him, I might have been killed too!!

だからその絶叫する表情は、顔の全ての筋肉を吊り上げた、まるで泣き笑いのような…、錯乱の形相だった。誰にもその表情を嘲笑えはしない…！！
As she screamed, her expression was filled with complete confusion, and all of the muscles of her face were pulled up, almost as though she was smiling while crying... But no one could have made fun of an expression like this...!!

「何事ですか、熊沢ッ！！　返事をしなさい、熊沢！！！」
"What is it, Kumasawa?!! Answer me, Kumasawa!!!"

一番最初に飛び込んできたのは、ライフル銃を構えた夏妃だった。
その後に戦人と源次が飛び込んでくる。
The first one to dash in was Natsuhi, holding the rifle.

Battler and Genji dashed in after her.

彼らは本来なら、このボイラー室に充満する猛烈な悪臭の発生源について議論するだろう。
……だが、血の海に溺れるかのように倒れている嘉音を前に、それは二の次だった。
Normally, they probably would've started discussing the origin of that violent stench filling the boiler room.

...But after they saw Kanon, who was lying on the ground as if he were drowning in an ocean of his own blood, the stench wasn't important anymore.

「嘉音！　返事をしなさい！！　……源次、南條先生をここにッ！！」
"Kanon! Answer me!! ...Genji, bring Doctor Nanjo here!!"

夏妃は嘉音が瀕死とはいえ、まだ意識があることに気付き源次に託す。
…夏妃はライフル銃を高々と構えると、ボイラー室の奥の暗がりに向けながら怒鳴る！
Natsuhi realized that even though Kanon was on the verge of death, he was still conscious, so she sent Genji to get the doctor.

...Natsuhi, holding the rifle aloft, faced the darkness in the center of the boiler room and shouted!

「……そこに隠れている者は何者ですッ！！！　大人しく出てきなさいッ！！　そちらから出てこないなら、容赦なく撃ちますッ！！」
"...Who is hiding over there?!!! Come out quietly!! If you don't come out from there, I'll shoot without mercy!!"

「ライトだ！　伯母さん、照らすぜッ！！」
"We need light! Aunt Natsuhi, let's light them up!!"

戦人が咄嗟の機転を利かし、入口脇の工具棚から大型の懐中電灯を取って、夏妃が睨みつける闇をその灯りで切り裂いた。
Battler, thinking quickly, took a large flashlight from the tool shelf alongside the door and used its light to cut through the darkness Natsuhi was glaring into.

だが、そこには無機質な配管と扉が照らし出されるだけだった。
But the light only shone on mechanical-looking piping and a door.

扉はわずかに隙間を残して開いており、何者かが慌しくそこから出て行ったらしいことは明白だった。
The door had been left open a small crack, and it was obvious that someone had left through there in a hurry.

「……夏妃伯母さん、あの扉はどこへッ？！」
"...Aunt Natsuhi, where does that door go?!"

「げ、源次…！　あの扉はどこに通じているのですか？！」
"G-Genji...! Where does that door lead to?!"

「…な、中庭です…！」
"...Th-The courtyard...!"

「に、逃がすかよッ、クソこの野郎ぉおおおおぉおおおぉッ！！！」
"L-Like hell I'd let you get away, you damn bastaaaaaaaard!!!"

戦人は雄叫びを上げながら扉に体当たりする。
Battler let out a war cry as he slammed into the door.

冷たい外気がどっと噴出してきた。
Cool air from outside suddenly rushed in.

…そこには細く粗末な登り階段があった。
…戦人は絶叫しながらそれを駆け上がっていく！
...There were some thin, rough stairs leading up.

...Battler ran up them, shouting!

「待ちなさい戦人くん！！　ひとりでは危険ですッ！！」
戦人の後を追い、夏妃も階段を駆け上がる。
"Wait, Battler-kun!! It's dangerous to be on your own right now!!"

Natsuhi was also rushing up the stairs, chasing after Battler.

そこは中庭だった。
They were in the courtyard.

…屋敷の中庭はもっぱら採光のために設けられたもので、それほど立派なところではなかった。
...The courtyard of the mansion had been built strictly for lighting purposes, so it wasn't a very elegant place.

四囲を囲まれているため、強い風の音を聞くことは出来ても、風の一切吹き込まぬ穏やかな空間だった。
Because it was surrounded on all sides, the air was calm and completely undisturbed, even though they could hear the sound of strong winds.

そして、そこにはしとしとと悲しみの雨だけが降っていた…。
There was only the gentle, sorrowful rain...

ぱらぱらと冷たい雫が降る中を駆け上がり、中庭に出た戦人は四方を見渡す。
……無論、不審な人影がのこのこと待ち構えていようはずもなかった…。
As he ran through the cold and scattered raindrops, dashing up the stairs into the courtyard, Battler looked in every direction.

......Of course, the odds of him finding a suspicious silhouette just standing around nonchalantly were pretty much zero...

戦人はぐるぐると四方を見渡す。ぐるぐると、ぐるぐると。方向感覚を失いそうになるくらいに、ぐるぐると。その光景の中に、犯人の姿があることを祈って…！
Battler spun, looking all around. He turned again and again. He kept spinning until he almost lost his sense of direction. He prayed that he would see the culprit somewhere in this scenery...!

だが、あるわけがない。
屋敷の壁と窓がいくつも無情に並ぶのがぐるぐると目に入るだけだ…！
But there was no chance.

All he saw as he spun was more and more of the mansion's heartless walls and windows...!

しかも、中庭から屋敷に入る入口は２つもあり、そのどちらにも鍵は掛かっていなかった。
Furthermore, there were two entrances into the mansion from the courtyard, and neither of them were locked.

中庭の構造上、屋敷の外から入れないため、鍵が設けられてなかったのだ。
Because the courtyard couldn't be entered from outside the mansion, the doors had been built without locks.

……これではどちらを出たのかわからない！　お手上げだった。
戦人は罵りの言葉と共に、握り拳を壁に叩きつけるのだった…。
......He didn't know which one they had left through! He had to give up.

Battler pounded the wall with his fist, swearing...

「……戦人くん！！　ひとりで先走っては駄目です！！
"...Battler-kun!! You mustn't run ahead by yourself!!

……………………。…………戦人くん……？」
............Battler-kun...?"

戦人は壁に額を付き、…爪を立てて掻き毟りながら泣いていた…。
Battler pressed his forehead against the wall, which he scratched at with his fingernails as he cried......

「………畜生、……畜生畜生…ッ！！　絵羽伯母さんに、秀吉伯父さん！　さらに嘉音くんかよッ！！！　６人も殺しやがった！！　飽き足らずさらに３人も殺しやがった！！　ふざけるな、ふざけるなぁああぁあぁッ！！　絵羽伯母さんも秀吉伯父さんも、昔からいつもやさしくしてくれる愉快な伯母さんたちだったじゃねぇかよ…！！　嘉音くんとは昨日会ったばかりだが、きっとこれから仲良くなれたと思うぜ？！　何で殺したんだッ！！
"......Damn it, ...damn it, damn it!! Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi! And now Kanon-kun!!! You killed a full six people!! And that wasn't enough, so you had to kill three more!! Are you kidding me, are you fucking kidding meeeeeeeeeeeee?!! Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi were always kind and fun...!! I just met Kanon yesterday, but I'm sure I'd have gotten along fine with him! Why did you kill them?!!

どうして、どうして…ッ！！！　人ってのはな、殺しちまったらな、二度と生き返らねぇんだぞ？！　竹の子みてぇにひょいひょい生えてきちゃこねぇんだぞッ？！　………どうして殺すんだよ？！　どうして…、
Why, why...?!!! You know, when people die, they don't come back to life again, right?! They aren't gonna quickly sprout up again like bamboo shoots!"

"......Why'd you kill them?! Why,

どうして…ッ！！！
...why...?!!!

うおおおおおぉおぉぉぉ…！！」
Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhh...!!"




…戦人は、人の心の痛みや無念がわかる男だった。…だから、泣く。力の限り。
...Battler was a boy who could understand the feelings of pain and regret in a person's heart. ...So he cried. With all his strength.

夏妃は、豪放そうな性格だと思っていた戦人に、こんな繊細な一面があったことを知って少しだけ驚くと共に、…まだ未成年である傷つきやすい戦人の心を理解し、受け止めた。
Natsuhi, who had always thought of Battler as a frank person, was a little surprised to find he had this delicate side, ...and at the same time, she understood how easily hurt the heart of a young person could be, so she held him.

「……………………大丈夫です。…あなたも、譲治くんも。真里亞ちゃんも朱志香も、私が絶対に守ります。………母として、…そして、右代宮家の代表として…！」
".........It's all right. ...I will definitely protect you, George-kun, Maria-chan, and Jessica. ......As a mother, ...and as the representative of the Ushiromiya family...!"

「……ううううぅうぅううぅ！！　うおおおぉおおぉおぉぉぉ！！」
"......Gyaaaaaaaahhh!! Aaaaaaaaaggghhhh!!"

戦人はしばらくの間、夏妃の胸で号泣した後、これまでもそうだったように、涙を拭きながら苦笑いして、充分に泣き尽くしたことをアピールした…。
Battler, after sobbing into Natsuhi's chest for a while, wiped his tears with a bitter smile, as though he had been like that the whole time, and tried to appear as though he'd cried more than enough already...

「とにかく、一度、下に戻りましょう。……犯人を捜すより、自分たちの身を守る方が最優先です。明日になれば船が来る。そうすれば警察がやって来て、全てを白日の下に晒し出してくれるでしょう。………犯人がどう足掻こうとも、この島から逃げられるものですか…！！」
"Anyway, let's go back down for now. ...Protecting ourselves is a higher priority than finding the culprit. Tomorrow, the boat will arrive. After that happens, the police will come, and everything should be brought to light. ......There's no way the culprit can escape this island, no matter how much they struggle...!!"

「……そうっすね。…警察さえ来れば。」
"...That's right. ...When the police come..."

うみねこのなく頃には、…事件は解決している。
When the seagulls cry, ...the crime will be solved.

でも、…なぜか戦人は、うみねこがもう二度と鳴いてくれないような、そんな不安感をわずかに覚える。
But, ...for some reason, Battler felt a slight sense of uneasiness, ...as if the seagulls would never cry again.

……そんなことがあるわけがない。
...That couldn't be true.

台風が過ぎ去れば、再び船着場には賑やかなうみねこたちが帰ってくるはずなのに……。
When the typhoon passes, surely the lively seagulls will return to the harbor again...

俺は夏妃伯母さんと一緒にボイラー室に戻り、何の収穫もなかったことを力なく伝えた。
I returned to the boiler room along with Aunt Natsuhi and told everyone weakly that we hadn't found anything.

嘉音くんは、南條先生と譲治の兄貴が二人で使用人室に運んだという。
使用人室には救急箱や流しがあり、保健室的な機能を持っているらしい。
We heard that Doctor Nanjo and George-aniki had carried Kanon-kun to the servant room.

The servant room had a first aid kit and a sink, and could apparently function as a nurse's office.

熊沢さんと朱志香もそれに同行した。
Kumasawa-san and Jessica had accompanied them.

…床には、嘉音くんが残した血溜まりが残っている。
...Stains from Kanon-kun's blood remained on the floor.

そのおびただしい出血量と、無造作に転がる凶器の無慈悲な形状から、
……多分、南條先生の手当ては徒労に終わるだろうと思った…。
Judging by the large amount of blood lost and the ruthless shape of the weapon that had fallen carelessly to the ground,

...I figured that Doctor Nanjo's treatment would probably end in vain...

その凶器は紛れもなく、絵羽伯母さんたちの眉間に刺さっていたものと同じだった。
……いや、柄の部分の悪魔のデザインが少し違うだろうか…？
That weapon was doubtlessly the same type that had been stuck in Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi's foreheads.

......But wait, isn't the demonic design on the handle a little different...?

その辺は多少の個性差だろう。
とにかく、同じ形状の凶器という意味ではまったく同じだった。
There seemed to be some small differences in that part.

Still, as far as their overall shape was concerned, the weapons were all of the same type.

絵羽伯母さんたちの時は、少々残酷だが、現場保全の意味もあり、凶器は突き刺さったままの状態にされた。
Though it had seemed brutal, we'd left the weapons stuck into Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi to preserve the crime scene.

…だからこうして、完全な状態で凶器全体を見るのはこれが初めてだった。
...So this was the first time we were able to have a perfect view of the entire weapon.

やはり凶器は、ナイフのような刃物ではなく、アイスピック状、…いや、細い杭状のものだった。
As we had expected, the weapon was not bladed like a knife, but shaped like an icepick, ...or rather, a thin stake.

しかもそこには、ドリル状？のような螺旋の意匠が施されていた。
And, ...it had a spiral-shaped pattern, sort of like a drill.

…悪趣味に例えれば、生贄の心臓に杭を打つために作られたような、そんな悪魔の儀式ご用達っぽくも見える…。
...It looked like something that might be driven into the hearts of human sacrifices in some demonic ritual...

全長は柄の部分も入れて２５ｃｍくらい。その半分ほどが真っ赤に血で染められた杭状の部分。
Including the handle, it was 25 centimeters long. Half of that was the stake-shaped part, which was stained with deep red blood.

……血に染まった部分の長さが、嘉音くんの胸をどれだけ深々と貫いていたかを想像させる…。
......The length of the bloodstained part made it clear just how deeply it must have penetrated into Kanon-kun's chest...

だが、夏妃伯母さんたちは凶器には目もくれず、凄まじい臭いを噴出している焼却炉の前にいた。
But Aunt Natsuhi and the rest didn't even look at the weapon, and instead stood in front of the incinerator, where the horrible stench was emanating from.

かつて、炉の中にくべられていたそれを、引きずり出したのだろう。
…それは未だ燻り、不快この上ない悪臭をもうもうと放ち続けていた…。
They must have dragged it out. Dragged out `that thing' which had been burning in the furnace.

...`It' was still smoldering and kept sending out dense waves of that awfully unpleasant smell...

源次さんと真里亞が、…それをじっと見下ろしている。
夏妃伯母さんは正視に堪えないのだろう。…首を何度も振りながら背を向けていた。
Genji-san and Maria stared down at it.

Aunt Natsuhi probably couldn't stand to look directly at it. ...She kept shaking her head, her back to it.

「……………………う…！」
"............Uu-...!"

…もうこれ以上、何を見ても驚かないつもりだったが、
……これは、
……、うぐ…！
...I thought nothing could surprise me after everything that's happened,

...but this is...

...gghh...!

思わず込み上げる吐き気に俺はしばらく呻いた…。
I stood there for a while, moaning, with a rising urge to vomit...

………あのこの世のものと思えない悪臭の正体は、………焼却炉で焼かれていた、
......The true source of that unearthly stench...

死体を焦がす臭いだったのだ……。
was a scorched corpse that had been cooking inside the incinerator...

着衣も体の表面も髪の毛も全て焼け爛れたそのグロテスクな死体は、こうなってしまっては顔や年齢はおろか、性別さえ見当がつかない…。
The clothes, the surface of the body, and the hair were all hideously burned. That grotesque corpse was in a state where not the face, nor the age, nor even the gender could be guessed at...

しかし、冷静に考えれば、現時点で出てくる死体は、１人しかいなかった。
………朝から姿を消し、行方のわからなかった、………祖父さまだ。
But when I thought about it calmly, I realized that a corpse appearing at this time could only be one person.

......It was Grandfather, who had disappeared that morning, and whose whereabouts had been unknown.

「………おそらく、…お館様だと思います。」
"......I believe...it is most likely the Master."

「……………私も、…同感です。…………このようなお姿でお亡くなりになるとは……。………おいたわしや…。」
"......I...agree. ......That he would pass away in such a state...... ......It's heartrending..."

「…でも、この死体、……本当に祖父さまだって保証はあるんすか…？　こうも黒焦げじゃ、性別さえも想像つかないってのに…。」
"...But...is there any proof that this corpse really is Grandfather...? It's burnt so black, you can't even tell what sex it is..."

「戦人くん、…足を御覧なさい。」
"Battler-kun, ...look at the feet."

夏妃伯母さんは、ハンカチで口元を覆い眼を背けながら、焼け焦げた死体の足を見ろと指し示す。
Aunt Natsuhi, with her handkerchief over her mouth and her eyes averted, pointed and told me to look at the burnt corpse's feet.

………………？
............?

「……両足の指が６本あるのがおわかりになりませんか。」
"...Notice how there are six toes on each foot."

「え？
"Huh?

………………あ、
……本当だ………。」
.........Ah,

...you're right......"

足の指が、確かに源次さんの言う通り、どちらの足にも６本ある。
それぞれの指が実にもっともらしく並んでいるので気付かなかった…。
Just as Genji-san had said, there were six toes on each foot.

Each individual toe had looked so normal in its line that I hadn't noticed...

「……お館様はお生まれの時から両足の指がそれぞれ６本でした。…そして、ゆえにお館様は右代宮家の再興を託されたのです。」
"...The Master was born with six toes on both of his feet. ...Consequently, the Master was entrusted with the revival of the Ushiromiya family."

「右代宮家には昔から、生まれつき多指症の方が多かったそうです。…多分、遺伝的なものでしょう。」
"I have heard that since long ago, cases of polydactyly were common in the Ushiromiya family. ...It's probably hereditary."

多指症ってのは、書いて字の如し。
Polydactyly literally means `many fingers'.

生まれる時のちょいとした神さまのミスで１本になるはずの指が２本に分かれてしまって、増えてしまうことがあるのだ。
Because of a little mistake by God when the person is born, one of their toes or fingers splits into two, and the total number increases.

ただ、多指症が世間で騒がれることはそうそうない。
なぜなら、これは病気ではなく、生まれつきのものだからだ。
But a big deal isn't usually made of polydactyly in the world at large.

That's because it isn't a disease, just something people are born with.

だから赤ん坊の時にもう病院は把握していて、１歳くらいになったら、手術して元通りに直してしまう。
So while they are still babies, at about the time they turn one year old, they can be taken to the hospital and given surgery to make them normal.

だから、仮に多指症だったとしても物心が付く前に治療されてしまっていて、子ども自身は覚えてすらいないわけだ。
Even a child with polydactyly can be treated before they become aware, so they might not even remember it themselves.

ちなみに、赤ん坊二千人に１人くらいの可能性で起こりえるものらしいので、人目には触れないながらも、決して珍しいものではない。
By the way, it seems that there's a possibility for this to occur in one out of every two thousand babies, so even though it's not usually seen, it isn't that rare at all.

そう言えば、秀吉伯父さんに昔、聞かされたことがあるような。…あの豊臣秀吉も手の指が６本あったんだとか…。
Speaking of which, I think Uncle Hideyoshi mentioned something to me long ago. ...Something about how even Toyotomi Hideyoshi, the man who unified Japan at the end of the Sengoku period, had six fingers on one hand...

夏妃伯母さんが言うには、右代宮家の歴代当主の中でも名君と讃えられた何人かが、みんな多指症だったらしい。
According to Aunt Natsuhi, among the many Ushiromiya Family Heads, the ones most praised for their wisdom all had polydactyly.

……そのため、祖父さまが生まれた時、名君の再来かと親族たちに騒がれたのだそうだ。で、関東大震災で主だった親族たちが全滅し、そこからお家を再興できるのは、吉祥の徴を持って生まれてきた祖父さまだ、ってな論法になったらしい。
...Because of that, when Grandfather was born, his relatives were all excited at the thought that he might become another wise leader. And, when the leading relatives all died in the Great Kanto Earthquake, it was apparently argued that Grandfather should be the one to restore the family, because of the auspicious sign of his birth.

もし祖父さまが当主もまんざらじゃないって思ったんなら、その６本目は幸運の指ってことになるのかもな。
If Grandfather hadn't disliked his position as the Head so much, this sixth toe probably would've been pretty lucky for him.

……そう言えば、どこかの国では多指症の人は神さまの使いだと信じられてて崇められてる、なんて話も聞いたような…。
...Come to think of it, I've heard about some country where it's believed people with polydactyly should be treated as gods and revered...

余談だが、推理小説なんかで死体を焼く時は、身元を不明にするための目的ですることが多いもんだ。
This is beside the point, but it's fairly common in mystery novels for a corpse to be burned to hide its identity.

……しかし、祖父さまの場合は、ちょっと焼いたくらいじゃ誤魔化せない、ちゃんとした証があったってことか…。
...But I guess that in Grandfather's case, just toasting him wouldn't be enough...

そして、……祖父さまの遺体はただ焼け焦げているだけではなかった。
And, ...Grandfather's body was not simply burnt.




……絵羽伯母さんたちと同じように、…そして嘉音くんの胸にも突き刺さっていた、
...It was just like Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi...and the thing that had been stabbed into Kanon-kun's chest.

あの“悪魔のアイスピック”が、…眉間に突き立てられている……！
One of those `demon's icepicks'...was stuck into his forehead...!

「…………指に、“当主の指輪”がありません。」
"......The Head's Ring is not on his finger."

「…昨夜の手紙のとおりということですか。
"...So the letter last night was telling the truth.

………………お父様、
……さぞやご無念でしょう……。」
.........Father...

would probably be horribly disappointed..."

夏妃さんはうな垂れ、硬く目を瞑る…。
Natsuhi-san let her head droop and closed her eyes tightly...

……この部屋も、警察に引き渡すべき重要な犯行現場となった。
……祖父さまの死体はここに残し、部屋は施錠して封印することとなった。
...This room had also become a vital crime scene for us to hand over to the police.

...It was decided that we would leave Grandfather's corpse here and lock the room, sealing it.

祖父さまの遺体はいつ頃から焼却炉で焼かれていたのかははっきりしない。
It isn't clear when Grandfather's corpse started burning in the incinerator.

源次さんが言うには、火勢がそんなに強くなかったので、だいぶ前から焼かれていて、炉から漏れ出した臭いが室内に少しずつ充満し、あふれ出して階段を登ってきたのではないかという。
Since, according to Genji, the strength of the flames hadn't been that strong, the body must have started burning a long time ago, so that stench could slowly creep out of the furnace and fill the room bit by bit, eventually pouring out and climbing up the staircase.

……レアかウェルダンかはとりあえず置いとくが、…とにかく祖父さまが、オートロックの密室に閉じこもっていたにもかかわらず、連れ出され、殺されて焼かれた。…そう見て間違いないだろう…。
...Putting aside whether he was rare or well-done, Grandfather had been brought out, killed, and burned...even though he had started out locked away in the closed room created by his auto-lock. ...There's probably no doubting this...

しかし、源次さんが言うには、ボイラー室は普段から施錠されているという。
However, according to Genji-san, the boiler room is usually locked.

……俺たち以外の誰かが潜んでいて犯行に及んでいる可能性が限りなく高くなり、しかもそいつはマスターキーのようなものを持ち歩いている可能性も高い。
......The possibility that someone outside our group had snuck in and committed the crime was overwhelmingly high, and there was also a good chance that this person was walking around with something like a master key.

…何しろ、今の屋敷内は戸締りがされていることになっている。
にもかかわらず、犯人はこうして屋敷内を自由に闊歩しているのだから。
...After all, the doors and windows throughout the mansion had been checked.

But despite that, the culprit was able to strut around the mansion freely.

この一件で、１９人目が存在することは確定したのか？
今までまったく姿を現さず、にもかかわらず存在をアピールするという矛盾。
Does this crime confirm that a 19th person exists?

There's still that contradiction, since they're trying to tout their existence without ever showing themselves once.

それを俺は、霧江さんのチェス盤理論で、逆に１９人目を否定してきた。
Along with Kyrie-san's chessboard theory, I've been using this contradiction to deny the existence of a 19th person.

…またしてもチェス盤をひっくり返すならば。これほど明らかに１９人目の存在がはっきりするなら、…ならばこそ、１９人目の存在など、なお一層ありえないということになる。その１９人目が姿を現さない限り…！
...By spinning the chessboard around once more, the very fact that this crime makes it perfectly obvious that a 19th person exists...means that the existence of the 19th person is even less plausible. As long as that 19th person doesn't show themselves in front of us...!

……レシートで封印した扉から祖父さまを連れ出し、チェーンで封印した扉の向こうの絵羽伯母さんたちを殺せた犯人なら、……怪しげなトリックや仕掛けで、見事架空の１９人目を生み出すことも可能なのか…？！？！
...If the culprit could get Grandfather out through the door sealed by the receipt, if they could kill Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi from the other side of a door sealed by a chain, ...then could they possibly go so far as to create a fictional 19th person through strange tricks and devices...?!?!

もし、１８人の中に犯人がいると今でも信じているなら、
……その容疑者は今やあまりに限られている。
If we still want to believe that the culprit is among the 18,

...then the list of suspects has grown very short.

俺たち子ども４人に、夏妃伯母さん。そして源次さん、熊沢の婆ちゃん、そして南條先生。…この中に犯人がいるってことになる！
The four of us kids, Aunt Natsuhi, Genji-san, Kumasawa baa-chan, and Doctor Nanjo. ...One of these people has to be the culprit!

いや、そうとも決め付けられない。
……さっき祖父さまの遺体が本当に本人か疑ったじゃないか。
Wait, we can't be sure of that.

......Just a second ago, we started doubting whether the corpse here was actually Grandfather's, right?

…同じことを、他の遺体についても考えてみるべきじゃないだろうか。
Maybe we can think of the other bodies in the same way.

例えば、最初に殺された６人は顔面を酷く破壊されていた。
For example, the first six all had their faces horribly smashed.

……面影を確認できる遺体もあったが、例えばウチのクソ親父辺りなんかは、綺麗にお面でも剥がすかのように、きっちりと顔面を失わされていた…。
...Some of the bodies had kept enough of their faces for us to confirm who they were, but that old bastard, for example...had lost his entire face, as though the whole thing had been neatly peeled off...

俺たちは服装と状況だけで遺体を特定したに過ぎない…。
We only figured out which body was which by their clothes and surroundings...

予め身代わりの死体を用意し、自らを死んだと偽装してどこかに隠れ潜んでいて犯行に及んでいるとか…？
Did the culprit prepare a fake body beforehand and alter it to make it look like they'd died, ...even though they were actually hiding somewhere after committing the crime...?

…そんな馬鹿なと思うが、それでも不可能なトリックじゃない。
...It may sound ridiculous, but it wouldn't be an impossible trick to pull off.

……１９人目、
……いや、………魔女に屈服するにはまだ早い……！
...It's too early to give in to this 19th person...

no, this witch...!

「真里亞ちゃん、それ以上しげしげと見てはなりません。さぁ戦人くんも。嘉音の容態も気になりますし、いつまでもこのようなところにはいられません。戻りましょう。」
"Maria-chan, you mustn't stare so fixedly anymore. Come on, Battler-kun too. I'm worried about Kanon's condition, and we mustn't remain in a place like this any longer than necessary. Let us return."

「……うー。」
"......Uu-."

真里亞はみんなと一緒に出て行かず、ボイラー室に残っていた。
しげしげと見ているのは多分、祖父さまの遺体じゃなくて、その眉間に付き立てられた“悪魔のアイスピック”の方だろう。
Maria didn't go out with everyone else, but remained in the boiler room.

The thing she was staring so fixedly at probably wasn't Grandfather's body, but the `demon's icepick' sticking out of his forehead.

…多分、マニアにゃ堪らない一本に違いない。
...It was probably the sort of item that an enthusiast couldn't bear to ignore.

その頭をコツンと叩く。
I tapped her on the head.

「おい真里亞。……ベアトリーチェの目的は何なんだ。俺たち全員の命か…？」
"Hey, Maria. ...What's Beatrice after? Is it all of our lives...?"

「……きひひひひひひひひ。ベアトリーチェはもうすぐ蘇るんだよ。…その時、誰も生き残れはしない。……きひひひひひひひひひひひ。」
"...Kihihihihihihihi. Beatrice will revive very soon. ...At that time, none shall be left alive. ...Kihihihihihihihi."

「よくも笑えるもんだぜ。自分だけ蚊帳の外だと思ってるのか？　どうして自分の身に危機が迫っていると感じない？　どうして怯えない？！」
"How can you laugh at something like that? Do you think you're the only one who's safe? Why don't you feel like you're in danger? Why aren't you scared?!"

「……ベアトリーチェは約束してくれたもん。…真里亞は黄金郷へ連れて行ってもらえるんだよ。
"...Beatrice made a promise. ...She said she's gonna take me to the Golden Land.

………そこはね、しがらみも何もない、全ての人たちがずっと一緒に、いつまでもやさしくしあって行ける素敵な場所なんだよ。
......It's a wonderful place where you have no obligations, everyone's always together, and everyone is always nice to everyone else."

………真里亞は楽しみだよ？　その時は、もうすぐだもん。…きひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひひ…。」
"......I'm looking forward to it. That time will come, very soon now. ...Kihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihi..."

…一体、真里亞は何者なんだ…。
...Just what kind of person is Maria...?

………俺は、６年前の３歳の時の真里亞しか知らない。無垢で素直ないい子だった。
.........I only know what Maria was like six years ago, when she was three. She was once pure and obedient, ...a good kid.

そして６年経ったこの真里亞と、…俺の知る真里亞が繋がらない。
This new Maria six years later and the Maria I knew...didn't seem to fit together.

……誰なんだ、この、真里亞と名乗る“魔女”は…。
...Just who is she, ...this `witch' who calls herself Maria...?

魔女の存在を頑なに妄信する彼女にとっては、……この一連の不可解な事件は全て、魔女が確かに存在する証。
To Maria, who obstinately believes in the witch, ......this series of unsolvable crimes is proof that the witch actually exists.

人間には困難な何かが起こる度に、俺たちはベアトリーチェという魔女の存在を信じなければならなくなる。
Every time something occurs that would be difficult for a human, it becomes a little harder for the rest of us to not believe in Beatrice.

それは真里亞にとって、…かつて頑なにその存在を否定し続けた親族たちが、次々に魔女の存在を認めていくという“痛快”なことでもある…。
It must be an `intense pleasure' for Maria to see her relatives, who once firmly denied the witch's existence, start acknowledging that witch's existence one by one...

……だから、上機嫌だってのか…？
......Is that why she's in high spirits...?

「………真里亞。もういっぺんだけ聞く。どうせ答えは同じだろうが、もういっぺんだけ聞く。」
".........Maria, let me ask this one more time. You'll probably answer the same anyway, but I'll ask just once more."

「うー…？」
"Uu-...?"

「…お前は昨日、薔薇庭園で手紙をもらった。……そいつは誰なんだ…！」
"...Yesterday, you were given a letter in the rose garden. ......Who gave it to you...?!"

「うー。…だからベアトリーチェ。…戦人がまだ信じない。うー。」
真里亞は従来の言葉を繰り返すだけだ。
"Uu-. ...Like I said, Beatrice. Battler still doesn't believe. Uu-."

Maria only repeated what she had already said.

……真里亞は１９人目の魔女に会っている。
...Maria met with the 19th person, the witch.

それは本当に１９人目なのか、それとも１８人の誰かに、そうだと言えと吹き込まれたのか。
Was that really a 19th person, or did one of the 18 just get her to say that?

ひとつだけ確かなのは、真里亞は俺たちとずっと一緒にいて、常にアリバイがあるし、不審な行動も一切ない。
All that's certain...is that Maria has been with the rest of us constantly, has always had an alibi, and hasn't done anything suspicious.

……ベアトリーチェのメッセンジャーにされ、心酔しているだけで、決して１９人目ではない。
...She's simply overjoyed at being made Beatrice's messenger...and certainly isn't the 19th person...

………………はず。
.........Supposedly.

そうだ。絵羽伯母さんたちの部屋で拾った手紙は、中に何と書かれているのだろう…。夏妃伯母さんがまだ持っているはず…。
That's right, I wonder what's written in the letter we picked up in Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi's room... Aunt Natsuhi should still have it with her...

……嘉音くんはついに、意識を取り戻すことはなかった。

There were many servants serving the Ushiromiya family.
